betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You find yourself into a world filled with unexpected challenges. After the devastating §l§nCalamity War§r, humanity's population has been drastically reduced to just §l§n1%§r. Should you choose to delve into this path, you'll uncover deep knowledge about the mysterious parasitic species that has devastated the planet. In this harsh new reality, mastering the art of revenge becomes essential for survival.


§4§l§nBounty Hunter Trait Perks:§o

§r§o• XP Rewards;
• Parasitic Mobs knowledge§r

§n§lThe Flying Carrier§r, true to its name, is an airborne explosive unit designed for transport. It features three containers filled with §4Buglins and Rupters§r, poised for deployment. This unit lacks conventional attack capabilities; instead, it explodes when it gets close to a player, unleashing all the parasites it carries and causing massive damage. The explosion also releases clouds of §2poison§r and COTH, along with a §2viral§r effect. A key vulnerability of the Flying Carrier is fire; §6igniting it prevents the explosion§r, neutralizing its threat before it can release its deadly cargo.

Approximately 33.3% of Flying Carriers are variants. Aside from their standard form, Flying Carriers have one specific variant known as the §8Empty Variant§r. This version contains no mobs, which allows for faster movement speeds and increased potency of effects. Notably, there is no texture difference between the Empty Variant and the standard Flying Carrier, making visual identification challenging.

§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Flying Carrier


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• When dealing with the Flying Carrier, it's advisable to equip ranged weapons that can ignite, such as flaming arrows. These weapons exploit the Carrier's vulnerability to fire, allowing you to neutralize its explosive threat from a safe distance.

§n§lThe Rupter§r, which evolves from the Buglin, initially appears peaceful. However, as it progresses through various phases, it becomes increasingly aggressive towards all living creatures. When a Rupter strikes another mob, it transmits the COTH effect to it. If the Rupter kills the mob, that creature is instantly transformed into its assimilated variant, further spreading the influence of the parasite. Rupters are highly agile creatures, known for their speed and ability to perform high leaps as well as climb vertical walls. Although individually weak, they become particularly dangerous when in groups, where their collective abilities and tactics enhance their performance dramatically.

They present 2 other variants:
§o• §c§oBerseker Variant§r§o, that inflicts §c§obleeding§r§o effect on hit (red colored)
• §2§oVirulent Variant§r§o, that inflicts §2§oviral§r§o effect on hit and contact (green colored)


§l§n§4§l§nTask:

§r§4• Kill 1 Rupter


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Critical strikes are highly effective against Rupters. Given their speed, it's challenging to outrun them, so it's advisable to engage in combat only when fully prepared.

§n§lThe Assimilated Cow§r is a transformed version of a Cow that has been exposed to COTH, retaining its basic shape while gaining special abilities. These creatures can perform a powerful charge attack after remaining stationary for a few seconds, delivering significant knockback and area-of-effect damage. Upon death, an Assimilated Cow may explode, dispersing Assimilated Remains, 3-4 Buglins, and a cloud of §2poison§r and COTH effects. If it doesn't explode, there's a 50% chance it will drop its Head.

§n§rMobs that become Assimilated Cows:
§o§r§o• Cows


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Assimilated Cow

§l§nThe Adapted Bolster§r is a formidable creature, featuring a wide mouth scattered with teeth across its body and two large, scythe-like arms for area-of-effect (AoE) melee combat. It is known for its high attack damage and range, tankiness, and slow movement. Adapted Bolsters can execute an AoE Barrage attack, where they remain stationary while flailing their tentacles, inflicting severe damage per second, bypassing immunity frames, and pulling in nearby targets. This powerful attack is signaled by flame particles and a distinctly louder, higher-pitched growl. Additionally, they can bestow §dRegeneration IV for one minute§r on nearby Parasites within 24 blocks every 60 seconds, enhancing their resilience in combat.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Adapted Bolster


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Stay away from close-up fighting at all costs.

§l§nThe Adapted Parasites§r are advanced forms of Primitive Parasites that have evolved after achieving ten takedowns on other mobs, reaching their full potential for adaptation. Starting from Phase Six, they can also spawn naturally. These parasites exhibit enhanced stats over their Primitive counterparts, with improvements in speed, damage, and durability. Additionally, Adapted Parasites possess the ability to break blocks with higher hardness values. On land, any Adapted Parasite can periodically vomit Residue, affecting a 5x5 area around it. Adapted Parasites possess the ability to sink below the surface to pursue submerged targets effectively. Additionally, they can execute powerful leaps, allowing them to swiftly navigate through water. These adaptations make them formidable adversaries in underwater encounters. Upon their demise, there's a chance the Adapted will explode, releasing Adapted Remains and creating an effect cloud of stacking §2poison§r and triggering the "COTH" effect.

Adapted Parasites exhibit a unique ability to generate §4§4Orbs§r during combat. These orbs§r are characterized by their red, translucent appearance and swelling "auras." When released, these orbs emit an aura that inflicts §4Exhaustion§r upon nearby players.

They present 3 other variants:
§o• §c§oBerseker Variant§r§o, that inflicts §c§obleeding§r§o effect on hit (red colored)
• §2§oVirulent Variant§r§o, that inflicts §2§oviral§r§o effect on hit and contact (green colored)
• §7§oBreacher Variant§r§o, that can §7§obreak blocks double the Hardness value§r§r§o of their to their Normal Variant (gray colored)


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Adapted Parasites are highly dangerous in melee combat and can damage your base. Plan your strategy carefully to effectively counter them.

§n§lThe Adapted Arachnida§r, an upgraded version of The Primitive Arachnida, has increased in size, both in its main body and legs, enhancing its speed and lethality. This evolved creature keeps its melee attack capabilities and retains the ability to §epull targets toward it§r, mirroring the behaviors of its Primitive form.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Adapted Arachnida


§r§n§lTip§r:

• Given their ability to pull enemies towards them, dodging the incoming web projectiles is crucial to avoid being ensnared. It's also advisable to utilize ranged weapons when engaging Adapted Arachnida, allowing you to maintain distance and minimize the risk of being pulled into melee range.

§l§nThe Adapted Yelloweye§r represents an advanced stage in the evolution of the Primitive Yelloweye, featuring significantly enhanced abilities. It possesses increased damage output, better sustainability in combat, and faster movement speeds. In addition to maintaining its ability to shoot projectiles and §2nades§r, the Adapted Yelloweye introduces a new §bmelee attack§r. This attack involves swooping down toward its enemies, allowing it to engage in close-quarters combat effectively, adding another layer of threat to its arsenal.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Adapted Yelloweye


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Dense forests provide advantageous terrain when confronting this mob, offering cover and obstacles that can help in evading and strategizing against its attacks.

§n§lThe Adapted Reeker§r stands as one of the most formidable Adapted Parasites, inheriting its §acharging§r ability from its Primitive counterpart. This evolved version also introduces a leaping ability, making it nearly impossible to escape by running. In addition to its enhanced stats, the Adapted Reeker continues to inflict §2poison§r with its melee attacks, maintaining its lethal combat presence.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Adapted Reeker


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Stay away from close-up fighting at all costs.

§l§nThe Adapted Manducater§r represents a significant evolution from the Primitive Manducater, featuring an entirely exposed skull and a taller, faster build. Its damage output has also increased. Like its predecessor, it can become §3invisible§r, but he only needs more than 40% health to activate the ability. While invisible, its speed decreases significantly, but its damage output doubles. Additionally, the Adapted Manducater has gained the ability to perform leaps on land, enhancing its mobility and unpredictability in combat.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Adapted Manducater


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Adapted Manducaters, along with other adapted parasites, have the ability to inflict §7Fear III§r on their targets. This means that even if a Manducater is invisible, the presence of the Fear III effect indicates the possibility that one may be lurking nearby.
Craft an §5§lEnergy Accepter§r. This machine block's sole purpose is to §bconvert RF Energy into AE Energy§r, for further usage of AE2 systems.

§lCheck the box to reset your progress for the Dispatcher's Rose.


§l§n§4§l§nIMPORTANT:

§r§4There is no way to undo this action. Make sure you are ready before proceeding!
No Description

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§n§lThe Adapted Longarms§r, an evolution of the Primitive Longarms, not only retains the ability to inflict area-of-effect (AoE) damage by swinging its newly grown, huge tentacles but also introduces an enhanced capability to climb walls, thanks to these tentacles. This version can still generate §cshockwaves§r, creating large damaging areas of disturbed ground. After standing still for a brief period, the Adapted Longarms will summon a Shockwave that moves forward at a slow speed, attempting to break any blocks it contacts and ignoring immunity frames while dealing massive vertical knockback. This action is indicated by flame particles and a higher-pitched growl. Additionally, the Adapted Longarms has a unique characteristic where its damage output increases as its health decreases—specifically, damage increases by 100% for every health point lost, making it more dangerous as it becomes more vulnerable.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Adapted Longarms


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• It's advisable to engage the Primitive Longarms from a safe distance using ranged weapons to avoid its powerful close-range attacks. Additionally, fighting from taller buildings isn't secure, as the creature has the ability to climb, allowing it to reach you even at higher elevations.

§l§nThe Adapted Summoner§r enhances the capabilities of its Primitive counterpart with significant improvements. It boasts better base stats and now has the ability to §dsummon Assimilated Parasites§r using Biomass. The summoned mobs spawn with the §4rage§r effect, increasing their aggression. Similar to Primitive Summoners, the Adapted Summoner can revive parasites. However, revived parasites by an Adapted Summoner will have 50% more health, enhancing their resilience in battle.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Adapted Summoner


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Given their effectiveness in supporting groups of parasites, it's advisable to prioritize taking down Adapted Summoners first, using a carefully planned strategy to mitigate their ability to enhance and revive other parasites.

§l§nThe Feral Parasites§r represent an advanced stage in the evolution of Assimilated Parasites, characterized by their entirely exposed bright red muscles, a result of their skin being completely ripped apart. These evolved creatures boast enhanced stats, including increased speed, defense, and damage. Their evolution can be triggered by an Assimilated Parasite achieving a certain number of mob takedowns, or by a Gnat killing a mob and possessing its body. Feral Parasites begin to spawn naturally starting from Phase 5. Unlike their Assimilated counterparts, Feral Parasites have the ability to §cperform leaps on land§r, making them more difficult to evade. Additionally, like Assimilated Parasites, they can swim underwater and have a chance to explode upon death, releasing Assimilated Remains along with an effect cloud of stacking §2poison§r and COTH.


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Always equip yourself with better gear before encountering Feral Parasites, as they are more powerful than their Assimilated counterparts. Proper preparation is crucial to withstand their enhanced abilities and attacks.

§l§nThe Crude Parasites§r are a unique class of parasites that inherit various mechanics and abilities from other types, including Adaptation, Assimilation, Evolution, and the Hijacking System. Despite possessing these complex traits, they exhibit abnormal behaviors and do not conform to a predictable pattern.

Their origins and unusual characteristics were a part of the intense study by §l§nBlockenstein§r, a renowned scientist and astronomer, prior to the §n§lCalamity War§r.

§n§lThe Feral Human§r emerges under specific conditions: either when a Zombie or Husk is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Human reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Human

§n§lThe Feral Sheep§r emerges under specific conditions: either when a Sheep is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Sheep reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Sheep

§n§lThe Feral Villager§r emerges under specific conditions: either when a Villager, Archaeologist, Lost Miner or Travelling Merchant is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Villager reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Villager

§n§lThe Feral Pig§r emerges under specific conditions: either when a Pig is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Pig reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Pig

§n§lThe Feral Enderman§r emerges under specific conditions: either when an Enderman is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Enderman reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures. Feral Endermen, a unique variant among Feral Parasites, boast enhanced versions of the Assimilated Enderman’s teleportation abilities. These creatures §5can teleport themselves and nearby entities such as Rupters, Walking Heads, Assimilated Mobs, Feral Parasites, and Primitive Parasites§r. Their teleportation process begins with an audible noise upon sighting a target, although they are unable to teleport during the first 1.5 seconds of target detection. Successful teleportation can also transport a nearby entity, inflicting minor damage of 0.5, unless the entity is an Assimilated Enderman, a Walking Enderman Head, or another Feral Enderman. The teleportation ability has a brief cooldown of 0.5 seconds. Additionally, if a Feral Enderman is on fire, there is a 75% chance that the teleported entity will also ignite. Like their counterparts, Feral Endermen are immune to ranged attacks, teleporting away from projectiles and show no weakness to water.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Enderman


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Feral Endermen are vulnerable to fire when teleporting mobs, a weakness you can exploit. Additionally, they move slower in water than on land, despite not taking water damage. Use these vulnerabilities to your advantage in combat.

§l§nPROGRESSION QUEST§r

The §4Dispatcher's Rose§r symbolizes the bright red flower of a Stage IV Dispatcher. When activated, it grants the ability to control all Architects and Workers within the vicinity, halting their activities in the Colonies.


1500 Compressed Hivestones ---> 1 Dispatcher's Rose

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You venture into the vast and dangerous world, only to realize that your enemies are capable of tearing down what you thought was a safe home... literally. It's time to stop that from happening by investing in a stronger infrastructure that can withstand even the toughest Parasites.

The journey begins with crafting an §a§lUpgrade-Base§r. This essential component, paired with Obsidian, forms the foundation for reinforcing your base. It serves as a crucial material for crafting various types of §nReinforcement Blocks§r.


§1§l§nBase Reinforcement Perks:§o

§r§o• XP Rewards;
• Reinforcement Knowledge
• Items for progression§r

§b§lThe Diamond Glass§r is the strongest and most resilient type of glass available, comparable in durability to real-life bulletproof glass. Crafting Diamond Glass involves melting Diamond Sand in any furnace. It can be dyed in any color and shaped into §nslabs and stairs§r, making it a versatile and user-friendly material for both decorative and structural applications.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§e§lThe Gold-Upgrade§r offers a significant boost in durability, surpassing the Iron-Upgrade in strength. This upgrade enhances standard materials with increased resilience, making them more effective at withstanding attacks from basic threats.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§lThe Iron-Upgrade§r enhances the strength and durability of standard building materials like Cobblestone, Wood, and Terracotta with iron-like resilience. Crafted by combining an Upgrade-Base with iron, this upgrade grants ordinary blocks improved resistance, making them essential for fortifying structures in parasite-infested zones.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§b§lThe Diamond-Upgrade§r raises durability further, outperforming the Gold-Upgrade and adding a tougher layer of defense. This upgrade ensures blocks are better protected against more powerful foes.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§l§nThe Crux§r is a formidable parasitic entity, resembling a massive golem with a humongous body. Its arms and legs are packed with powerful muscles, enabling it to break very hardened blocks. According to studies by Blockenstein, the Crux, like the Heed, originated from warmer climates such as the Nether and has adapted to colder environments. It can also be created through the assimilation of a Trollager, emerging as one of the most aggressive parasites, perpetually under the influence of the §dRage§r effect and attacking any mob in sight.

In combat, the Crux has the unique ability to §4grab and throw the nearest block as a projectile§r, causing damage equivalent to its base attack. This projectile can break through leaf blocks and the ability to throw depends on the hardness of the block, which must align with the Crux's breaking capacity. Once thrown, the block will also land and remain on the ground. For each entity it kills, the Crux's damage increases by 12%, and this can stack up to 10 times. Additionally, Cruxes are capable of performing small leaps in liquids and can sink in liquids to pursue submerged targets, adding to their versatility and threat in aquatic environments.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Crux


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Be vigilant in preventing the Crux from approaching your base, as its ability to break very hardened blocks means it can quickly cause significant destruction. It's crucial to engage and divert it away from any critical structures to minimize damage.

§a§lThe Emerald-Upgrade§r exceeds Diamond in durability, reinforcing materials with an even greater level of strength. With this upgrade, structures are well-prepared to resist advanced assaults.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§8§lThe Obsidian-Upgrade§r takes resilience to the next level, outmatching Emerald and providing outstanding reinforcement. It is ideal for fortifying structures in high-risk areas facing constant threats.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

Finally, the §d§lManyullyn-Upgrade§r represents the ultimate in strength and durability. As the strongest upgrade available, it offers unmatched protection, making it essential for surviving in the most hostile environments.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Nothing§r

§8§lObsidian§r is the top choice for reinforcing bases against especially powerful parasites. Its versatility allows it to be crafted into various forms, including §nchests, furnaces, slabs, stairs, and pressure plates§r.

Additionally, Obsidian Pressure Plates can be configured in the Crafting Table to respond exclusively to players, enhancing security and control over access points.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o

 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§lThe Iron Door and Iron Trapdoor§r are ideal choices for early-game defense, offering solid protection against most parasites. Later on, they can be upgraded to Metal Doors and Trapdoors, providing an additional layer of security and enhanced durability against tougher threats.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I

§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Pure Parasites

 • Nexus Stage III

 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§7§lThe Metal Door and Metal Trapdoor§r are upgraded versions of the standard iron variants, offering superior protection against more dangerous parasites. These reinforced doors add an extra layer of security, making them essential for withstanding higher-level parasite threats.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o

 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§5§lThe Metal Reinforced Door§r offers the ultimate defense, capable of withstanding every type of parasite attack. Crafted from a dense blend of Manyullyn, Steel, and Iron, this door provides unmatched protection, making it an essential barrier in the most hostile environments.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Nothing§r

§n§lThe Thrall§r is an evolved form of the Assimilated Adventurer, reaching this stage after accumulating a specific number of takedowns. Additionally, Thralls naturally spawn starting from Phase Four. These creatures are notably taller and faster than their predecessors, significantly increasing their threat level. Thralls possess an adaptive ability where they become increasingly resistant to damage from a specific weapon or mob the more they are hit by it. This adaptation can be mitigated by setting the Thrall on fire, a tactic strongly advised to counter their resilience.

Upon death, Thralls may explode, dispersing Primitive Remains and releasing a cloud of stacking Poison and COTH. Despite undergoing an evolutionary process similar to assimilation, Blockenstein has noted that Thralls do not share any significant biological similarities with Feral Parasites and only a minimal resemblance to Primitive Parasites. This distinct blend of traits places Thralls in a unique category of their own within the parasitic hierarchy.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Thrall


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Thralls are exceptionally tall, which can be a strategic disadvantage in certain environments. If you position yourself in a small gap or a low-clearance area, their height prevents them from reaching you, providing a tactical advantage during encounters.

§e§lThe Reinforced Torch§r, crafted from Obsidian, provides a durable and versatile lighting solution. It not only keeps areas illuminated but also offers protection against early to mid-game parasites, making it an excellent choice for maintaining safe, well-lit spaces.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt


§4§lBad Against:§r
§o
 • Pure Parasites
 • Nexus Stage II 
 • Succor
 • Deterrent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage III 
 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon
 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§6§lThe Reinforced Glowstone§r stands as the most secure illuminating block available, matching the strength and durability of Obsidian. It can withstand powerful threats, including the Crux and the Assimilated Ender Dragon, making it one of the most reliable and essential lighting options for fortified areas.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o
 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites

§c§lThe Gold, Iron, and Pearl Redstone Components§r offer sufficient durability to withstand most parasites, ensuring secure and reliable redstone circuits throughout your base. These components are essential for maintaining functional and protected redstone systems in parasite-prone areas.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o

§9§lThe Metal Ladder§r offers exceptional durability, built from compressed metal bars that allow it to withstand most parasites. Its resilience makes it impervious to Pure Parasites, making this ladder an ideal choice for constructing secure vertical entrances.


§a§lGood against:§r
§o

§4§lBad Against:§r
§o

 • Ancient Parasites
 • Preeminent Parasites
 • Nexus Stage IV§r

§4§lThe Reinforced Air Balloon§r is the most durable component of an aircraft controlled by the Ship's Node. It offers strong resistance against most parasites while maintaining a lightweight, low-density structure, making it an ideal material for keeping the aircraft airborne and secure.

 • Primitive Parasites
 • Adapted Parasites
 • Nexus Stage I 
 • Grunt
 • Pure Parasites

 • Succor

 • Crux
 • Assimilated Ender Dragon

§o

 • Preeminent Parasites
