§l§nThe Incomplete Forms§r are categorized into two sizes: medium and small. These forms result from an incomplete assimilation process in which the host mob fails to fully integrate the parasitic traits. They pose only a minor threat due to their slow movement and reliance on contact to inflict damage. However, they are noteworthy for their high knockback resistance in combat. Despite these attributes, their incomplete nature means they do not qualify as Assimilated Variants, as noted by the scientist and astronomer Blockenstein. This distinction is important for understanding their role and limitations within the broader context of parasitic entities.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Medium Incomplete Form
• Kill 1 Small Incomplete Form

§l§nThe Aloe§r is one of three parasitic entities that cannot evolve independently; instead, it requires the assistance of Beckons and Scents to merge and transform. Although relatively slow in movement, Aloes compensate with high damage upon direct contact, an immunity to knockback, and substantial resistance to damage. According to Blockenstein, the Aloe's inability to evolve autonomously indicates that the climate of the Overworld does not suit its adaptive needs, suggesting its evolutionary mechanisms are more aligned with different environmental conditions.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Aloe


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Since the Aloe is resistant to knockback, kiting — maintaining a distance while attacking — is the most effective strategy to manage and defeat it without getting too close and risking high damage from direct contact.

§l§nThe Host§r is a terrifying amalgamation of skeletons, forming a formidable monstrosity with significant damage, armor, and HP, making melee combat ill-advised. Hosts function as Burrowing hybrids, combining melee, ranged, and summoning abilities. §4They can only move when underground§r and are immobile on the surface, releasing Residue as they traverse below. Should its prey stray too far, the Host can teleport close to them. Their melee assault, delivered by slamming their massive tentacles, causes knockback and area-of-effect damage. For ranged attacks, they hurl bombs that inflict §2Poison, COTH, and Viral§r effects upon detonation. While underground, they can §4summon Rupters and create Waves§r — small zones of damage that accelerate toward their target. These Waves deal substantial damage per second and bypass immunity frames.

Research by Blockenstein suggests that the Host is native to warmer regions, like the Nether, but has adapted to chillier environments. It can also be spawned when an §6Assimilated Human or Villager defeats 3 Skeletons§r. When vanquished, the Host may drop a Host Tentacle, a potent melee weapon. Additionally, §6upon achieving 40 kills, a Host will evolve into a Herd§r.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Host


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• When battling the Host, bring a Flint and Steel. While the creature is burrowed underground, igniting the surface above will inflict damage on it.

§n§lThe Hijacked Golem§r is a transformative evolution of the Iron and Gold Golems, brought about through the §ehijacking process§r facilitated by Gnats, which explode upon contact with the Golem. This evolved form retains the original structure of the golem but is distinguished by tendrils protruding from its head. The Hijacked Golem is characterized by its aggressive nature and exhibits high speed, durability, and considerable damage through direct contact. Additionally, it has the capability to perform small leaps both on land and in liquids. The Hijacked Golem's ability to sink in liquids also enables it to pursue submerged targets effectively, adding to its versatility as a formidable adversary.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Hijacked Golem


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Hijacked Golems are highly aggressive and unpredictable, making them dangerous adversaries. It’s essential to approach them with extreme caution, ideally with a well-thought-out strategy to manage their swift and robust attacks effectively.

§l§nThe Herd§r is the evolved form of the Host. This formidable creature boasts enhanced stats, including increased damage, armor, and HP, making it significantly §4more powerful than a Pure Parasite§r. The Herd appears as a towering mass of assorted skeletons, complete with more tentacles than its predecessor. Its melee attack involves slamming its large tentacles, causing knockback and area-of-effect damage. For ranged assaults, it fires Bombs in bursts of up to two, delivering §2Poison, COTH, and Viral§r effects upon explosion. Additionally, it can shoot a poisonous projectile in bursts of up to three from its upper section, which inflicts Poison for a limited duration. While underground, the Herd §4can summon Manglers and create Waves§r — small zones of damage that home in on targets at high speed and bypass immunity frames.

The parasite uses §dAdaptation§r as a defensive strategy, reducing damage taken from specific weapons or mobs with each hit it receives. Research by Blockenstein indicates that this creature is originally from warmer climates, such as the Nether, but it has successfully adapted to colder environments. It emerges after §6a Host accumulates 40 kills§r. When vanquished, the Host may 2 Host Tentacles, potent melee weapons.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Herd


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• When confronting the Herd, it is crucial not to engage in close combat due to its immense damage output. Instead, wait for it to surface and attack from a distance using ranged weapons for a safer approach.

§l§nThe Heed§r is an unusual parasitic entity that resembles a hybrid of a giant ant and a large spider. Its body features several independent skulls and a single massive mouth. According to the theories of Blockenstein, the Heed began its evolutionary journey in warmer climates such as the Nether and underground regions before adapting to colder environments. This adaptation process can also involve Gnats §6infesting a Coolmar Spider§r found in the Nether, utilizing the Hijacking System to transform it into a Heed. The creature's multiple legs grant it high speeds, and it is capable of inflicting direct damage through contact with its enormous mouth. A notable special ability observed in some Heeds is their capacity to §asummon Scents§r as a defensive mechanism when threatened.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Heed


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Approach Heeds with caution as they possess the ability to call for backup by summoning Scents through their Scent System. This defensive mechanism can quickly escalate a confrontation, so it's wise to be prepared for additional threats when engaging them.

§l§nThe Heartdemon§r is one of three parasitic entities that cannot evolve independently; instead, it requires the assistance of Beckons and Scents to merge and transform. It has medium movement speed and high damage, and importantly, it does present knockback resistance. This trait makes it tougher to manage in combat since it cannot be easily pushed back or disrupted by attacks. According to Blockenstein, the Heartdemon's inability to evolve autonomously indicates that the climate of the Overworld does not suit its adaptive needs, suggesting its evolutionary mechanisms are more aligned with different environmental conditions.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Heartdemon


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Since the Heartdemon is resistant to knockback, kiting — maintaining a distance while attacking — is the most effective strategy to manage and defeat it without getting too close and risking high damage from direct contact.

§l§nThe Patrolman§r is one of three parasitic entities that cannot evolve independently; instead, it requires the assistance of Beckons and Scents to merge and transform. The Aloe parasites exhibit medium movement speed and extremely high damage, alongside their knockback resistance, making them formidable in direct encounters. However, their lower sustain or durability means that while they can deal significant damage, they may not withstand sustained attacks for long. This vulnerability can be exploited to overcome them in combat. According to Blockenstein, the Patrolman's inability to evolve autonomously indicates that the climate of the Overworld does not suit its adaptive needs, suggesting its evolutionary mechanisms are more aligned with different environmental conditions.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Patrolman


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Since the Patrolman is resistant to knockback, kiting — maintaining a distance while attacking — is the most effective strategy to manage and defeat it without getting too close and risking high damage from direct contact.

§l§nThe Pure Parasites§r represent a unique class of parasitic entities that evolve not through conventional systems but directly from specific environmental conditions. When factors like a high-stage Beckon presence or a Parasite Biome are in place, Pure Parasites emerge. These creatures possess the ability to adapt to incoming damage, break through tough blocks, and generally exhibit superior stats—including health, speed, and damage—compared to Adapted Parasites. Pure Parasites are not only formidable on land but also highly capable in aquatic environments. They can perform small leaps in water and have the ability to sink to pursue submerged targets effectively. Adding to their versatility in combat, Pure Parasites possess the unique ability to §4summon Seizers and Dispatcher Tentacles§r. These summoned entities provide substantial support during battles, enhancing the Pure Parasites' overall combat effectiveness and making them even more challenging to contend with. Upon death, Pure Parasites may explode, creating a hazardous situation. This explosion releases Pure Remains and generates an effect cloud that stacks Poison and COTH, posing a continued threat even after the parasite has been neutralized. 

Pure Parasites exhibit a unique ability to generate §4§4Orbs§r during combat. These orbs§r are characterized by their red, translucent appearance and swelling "auras." When released, these orbs emit an aura that inflicts §4Exhaustion§r upon nearby players.


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Due to their enhanced abilities and aggressive nature, Pure Parasites are more powerful than their Adapted counterparts. The most effective method of engaging them in combat is through the use of ranged weapons. Utilizing bows, guns, and shurikens allows for maintaining distance while delivering impactful strikes, which is crucial given the significant threat posed by these formidable foes.

§r§l§nThe Warden§r is a daunting parasitic entity, characterized by its long arms that stretch towards its legs, a massive circular mouth, and two prominent horns on its back. These creatures are native to the Parasite Biome and are spawned by Stage III Beckons. Their attack involves an area-of-effect (AoE) damage mechanic executed by thrusting their limbs upward.

Wardens are agile, capable of §aclimbing blocks§r and executing significant leaps that cause AoE damage upon landing. They also have a powerful charge attack; after a brief pause during which they cover their face with their arms, they dash forward at high speed, delivering substantial knockback and AoE damage, all while bypassing immunity frames. This action is signaled by flame particles, a high-pitched growl, and the distinctive arm position. They also employ regular evasive dashes to avoid attacks, adding to their complexity as opponents.

Additionally, Wardens can generate §7§6shockwaves§r that create large damaging areas on the ground. After standing still momentarily, they release a wave that moves slowly forward, capable of breaking any blocks in its path and causing massive vertical knockback, also signaled by flame particles and a higher-pitched growl.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Warden


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Despite their formidable abilities, Wardens have a vulnerability: the two horns on their back. Strikes to this weak spot inflict triple damage and apply a bleeding effect, making strategic targeting essential in combat situations.

§n§lThe Marauder§r, is a massive land combat monstrosity characterized by two high tentacles in place of arms, which it uses to inflict area-of-effect (AoE) damage through direct contact. These creatures primarily spawn by merging into Parasite Biomes. A distinctive aspect of the Marauder's combat abilities is its second melee attack, where it can §6grab nearby mobs and brutally punch them to death§r. During this attack, the Marauder remains stationary, moving its limbs back and forth from its body, and this powerful attack bypasses immunity frames.

After executing this attack, the Marauder emits the Rage Effect, energizing nearby Parasites. Marauders are quite agile; they can climb blocks and execute significant leaps that cause AoE damage upon landing. They are also capable of performing smaller leaps both on land and in liquids, enhancing their mobility.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Marauder


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Marauders' Tendrils, found on the sides of their body, can reset their adaptation if hurt, while also giving them the Bleeding and Rage Effects.

§r§l§nThe Monarch§r, a formidable Pure Parasite, resembles a huge scorpion with six tall legs and a distinctive tail that lacks a stinger. These creatures emerge from Phase Seven and inhabit Parasite Biomes. Monarchs engage in melee through direct contact damage and are adept at using web projectiles to immobilize their targets, effectively §atrapping them in §aweb blocks§r. During their aerial leap attack, they release 5 Buglins, and their short charge maneuver also results in the spawning of 3 Buglins, enhancing their offensive capabilities. Additionally, Monarchs are known to perform short evasive dashes to avoid incoming attacks, contributing to their high survivability. 


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Monarch


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Given their versatile and mobile nature, engaging Monarchs at a distance is advisable to mitigate the risks of their rapid and multi-faceted assault strategies.

§n§lThe Grunt§r is a highly mobile and small combatant known for attacking in squads. The Grunt's body resembles a smaller version of the Marauder, complete with two tendrils. These creatures typically spawn in Parasite Biomes or are aided in their appearance by other stronger parasites. In combat, Grunts are formidable due to their ability to inflict area-of-effect (AoE) damage with their melee attacks. Their agility is further highlighted by several capabilities: they can climb blocks, perform significant leaps to overcome obstacles or close distances quickly, and they regularly execute short evasive dashes to avoid attacks. This combination of mobility and tactical group behavior makes Grunts particularly challenging to contend with, especially when they coordinate their attacks in squad formations.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Grunt

§n§lThe Overseer§r is a menacing flying parasite, distinguished by its lack of eyes and a long tubular mouth, making it a sinister presence in any encounter. It typically spawns in the Parasite Biome or is summoned by Stage III Beckons. In close combat, the Overseer engages by swooping down towards its foes, while at a distance, it unleashes up to six explosive projectiles in rapid succession that inflict the Needler effect.

A key tactical ability of the Overseer is its capacity to §bsummon Rupters and Grunts using Biomass projectiles§r. These projectiles transform into Biomass entities upon contact with the ground or a target, and the summoned mobs are imbued with the Rage Effect, enhancing their aggressiveness. The act of spawning Biomass is marked by specific particles visible on the Overseer, indicating when it is using this attack. Notably, the Overseer refrains from using this biomass-based attack if the target is above ground, preferring to engage with its other formidable tactics.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Overseer


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Furthermore, the Overseer has a critical vulnerability: its head and a portion of its neck serve as a weak point. Strikes to this area cause triple damage and induce the Bleeding Effect, providing a strategic opportunity to inflict significant damage. This vulnerability is crucial for combatants looking to quickly neutralize this dangerous parasite.

§n§lThe Light Bombers§r are aerial bombardiers characterized by their ability to spawn in Parasite Biomes or through the summoning power of Stage III Beckons. As flying units, their primary method of attack involves §6dropping bombs§r during flight. These bombs are not only capable of destroying blocks but also release a trio of potent effects upon detonation: §3§2Poison, Viral§r, and COTH, making them particularly hazardous in combat situations.

A tactical note about the Light Bombers is their limitation in attack deployment; they will not utilize their bombing attack if the target is located above ground. This indicates a strategic preference for attacking targets that are on the same level or below them.

Although not a primary mode of attack, Light Bombers can inflict contact damage if circumstances bring them into direct contact with a target. However, they do not actively seek to engage in such close-range interactions, preferring to utilize their bombing capabilities from a distance. This makes them uniquely dangerous as support units in larger combat scenarios, where they can fly above and deliver explosive damage without direct confrontation.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Light Bomber

§l§nThe Vigilante§r is a medium-sized, three-legged defender parasite known for its tactical presence in combat. It can appear naturally in Parasite Biomes or be summoned by Stage III Beckons. In close combat, Vigilantes deliver damage through direct contact with their foes. However, they are particularly notable for their ranged capabilities, rapidly firing projectiles that not only hit hard but also leave behind a lingering cloud. This cloud inflicts §2Poison and Corrosion§r on any who enter it, making Vigilantes effective at controlling the battlefield from a distance. While engaging in ranged attacks, Vigilantes prefer to maintain their position, standing still to focus their fire, and will only move if a target approaches too closely. This tactical behavior allows them to maximize their impact in combat while minimizing exposure to direct threats.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Vigilante


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Vigilantes' Tendrils, found on the upper sides of their body, can reset their adaptation, while also giving them the Bleeding and Rage Effects.

§l§nThe Preeminent Parasites§r represent the apex of parasitic evolution and complexity, found exclusively within Parasite Biomes where they play a crucial role in defending and propagating these zones. These grotesque giants are daunting foes, necessitating the use of the most powerful weapons and the sturdiest armor sets available in the game to stand a chance against them. They possess an extraordinary ability to §bbreak nearly any block in their path, excluding bedrock§r, showcasing their formidable strength and destructiveness, also adapting quickly to the incoming damage.

During combat, Preeminent Parasites are not solitary in their assault; they §esummon Succors§r, agile flying parasites that also have block-breaking capabilities. These Succors enhance the battlefield control of the Preeminents by generating §corbs§r that debilitate players in multiple ways: inducing §7Exhaustion§r, adding cooldowns to player items, and applying various potion effects to any entities within their effective range. Additionally, orbs released by Heavy Bomber Succors can siphon experience points from players, further complicating the combat dynamics.

Moreover, land-based Preeminent Parasites display an ability to adapt to aquatic environments by diving into liquids to chase down submerged targets. This versatility in combat tactics makes the Preeminent Parasites a formidable class of enemies, requiring strategic planning and significant resources to overcome. Their presence in the game underscores high-stakes challenges designed to test the limits of player skill and preparation.


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Despite their formidable abilities and resilience, Preeminent Parasites retain a vulnerability to fire. This weakness can be strategically exploited in combat to gain an advantage. Utilizing fire-based weapons or abilities can significantly reduce their effectiveness and durability, providing a critical edge in battles against these powerful foes.

§n§r§l§nThe Haunter§r is a formidable giant parasite characterized by four sturdy, tall legs and four tentacles in place of a face. Despite its slow movement, the Haunter is versatile in combat, capable of both direct melee and ranged attacks. Its melee attacks are particularly dangerous, as they can occasionally ignore immunity frames, allowing for brief bursts of unblockable damage.

In addition to its powerful close-range capabilities, the Hunter can launch §afast homing projectiles in bursts of three§r. These projectiles have the unique ability to phase through walls, adding a challenging layer to combat, although they can be destroyed if targeted effectively.

To further complicate engagements, the Haunter is adept at performing large evasive dashes, allowing it to quickly reposition itself on the battlefield and dodge incoming attacks. This agility, combined with its robust attack methods, makes the Hunter a challenging adversary in any encounter.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Haunter

§l§nThe Colony Carrier§r is a formidable and durable humongous parasite, with a body structure reminiscent of a giant ant. It serves as a heavy support unit in the parasitic ranks, providing critical buffs to nearby parasites to enhance their combat effectiveness. The effects it applies include §bRegeneration III§r for 30 seconds, §9Foster II§r for one minute, and §dLink I§r for 10 seconds, significantly boosting the survivability and potency of its allies.

Approximately 33.3% of Colony Carriers manifest in a variant form. The known variant of the Colony Carrier is the §7Armored Variant§r, which is equipped with an additional 2.5 armor points, enhancing its defensive capabilities at the cost of reduced movement speed. This variant provides a strategic advantage in sustained engagements, allowing it to support its allies while enduring more damage from enemy attacks.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Colony Carrier


§r§l§nTip:§r

• The back of the Colony Carrier serves as a critical weak point in its otherwise formidable defense. Striking this specific area significantly increases the vulnerability of the Colony Carrier: any damage dealt to this weak point is tripled, and the Bleeding Effect is applied.

§l§nThe Heavy Bomber§r is a massive, balloon-like airborne parasite that combines the roles of a tank, bomber, and summoner, with additional basic melee capabilities. Designed to dominate from the air, it typically hovers above its target to deploy its bombs effectively. Its primary mode of attack involves dropping bombs that not only destroy blocks but also have the unique ability to spawn formidable mobs upon detonation. These explosives can §esummon powerful entities such as an Overseer, Vigilante, Marauder, or Monarch§r, significantly escalating the complexity of the battlefield.

Strategically, the Heavy Bomber is programmed not to deploy its bombing attack if the target is positioned above ground level, which integrates an interesting layer of tactical depth to its engagements. Additionally, the Heavy Bomber can engage in direct combat by occasionally swooping down to inflict contact damage, offering a blend of aerial and close-range threats to its adversaries. This versatility makes the Heavy Bomber a highly dangerous opponent in any combat scenario.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Heavy Bomber

§l§nThe Bogle§r is a massive Flying Stealth Bomber with a formidable presence and multiple limbs, making it not only a menacing sight but also a versatile combatant. Equipped with the capability to shoot highly explosive projectiles, the Bogle excels in ranged attacks, although it refrains from using this ability if its target is midair, adding a strategic dimension to its engagement tactics.

Adding to its lethal arsenal is a damaging melee aura that ignores immunity frames, ensuring that any close encounters with the Bogle are particularly dangerous. Occasionally, the Bogle will execute a swooping attack from above, enhancing its effectiveness in sudden offensive maneuvers.

One of the most distinctive features of the Bogle is its ability to §cbecome completely invisible§r, making it an elusive target. This invisibility is temporarily disrupted when the Bogle shoots, takes damage, or when its health drops below 40% of its maximum. Furthermore, any Succors it spawns while invisible will also appear with the invisibility effect for 3 seconds, increasing the complexity of battles involving this unit. This combination of stealth, aerial bombardment, and close-range danger makes the Bogle a critical threat in any combat scenario.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Bogle


§l§n§r§l§nTip:

§r• Flaming projectiles are particularly effective against the Bogle, an invisible parasite. Not only does fire exploit its inherent weakness, but it also prevents the Bogle from becoming invisible once it's ignited.

§n§lThe Wraith§r is a colossal flying, stealth-based ranged parasite that also possesses melee capabilities. Similar to the Bogle, it features multiple limbs extending from its body, enhancing its intimidating presence. The Wraith specializes in launching Nades rapidly in bursts of three, providing a powerful ranged attack option. However, it strategically refrains from using this attack when its target is in midair, requiring precise timing and positioning to maximize effectiveness.

In close combat, the Wraith employs a damaging melee aura that bypasses immunity frames, ensuring it can consistently inflict damage regardless of an opponent's defensive tactics. One of the Wraith's most formidable abilities is its capacity to §cbecome completely invisible§r, significantly complicating enemy attempts to track and engage it. This invisibility is only disrupted under specific conditions: when the Wraith shoots, takes damage, or when its health drops below 40% of its maximum.

Additionally, any Succors that are spawned while the Wraith is invisible will inherit this invisibility effect for a brief period of 3 seconds, further adding to the chaos and difficulty in combating this elusive enemy. This combination of stealth, ranged bombardment, and robust melee attacks makes the Wraith a multifaceted threat in any combat scenario.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Wraith


§l§n§r§l§nTip:

§r• Flaming projectiles are particularly effective against the Wraith, an invisible parasite. Not only does fire exploit its inherent weakness, but it also prevents the Wraith from becoming invisible once it's ignited.

§o§r§n§lThe Succor§r is a smaller, sphere-shaped parasite that plays a crucial support role for every Preeminent parasite by aiding them in combat. This flying entity is not only capable of breaking blocks but also adapts to damage, enhancing its durability. 

When a Succor approaches an enemy, it can either explode, releasing Pure Remains and spreading Residue along with a cloud that inflicts Poison, Wither, and COTH, or it might §bdeploy an Orb§r carrying the effects of the parasite that summoned it. Another capability includes §ateleporting the parasite that spawned it directly to its location§r, providing strategic repositioning advantages in battle. After executing one of these actions, the Succor will disappear and die, serving its purpose as a transient but impactful combat tool.

If killed before it can act, the Succor will either explode, mimicking its effect when near a target, or simply die without further consequence. This designates the Succor as a pivotal element in the offensive strategies of Preeminent parasites, significantly affecting the dynamics of combat encounters.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Succor

§n§lThe Ancient Overlord§r stands as one of the two most formidable individual parasites ever to emerge, notable for its immense size and the presence of six massive legs and tendrils that jut out from its head. In melee combat, the Overlord excels, dealing contact damage that results in area-of-effect (AoE) damage and significant knockback to any foes nearby. For ranged combat, it employs a §bhoming projectile that seeks out targets§r, enhancing its threat from a distance.

In terms of environmental interaction, the Ancient Overlord possesses the strength to §dbreak every block in the game, except bedrock§r. Like many other parasitic entities, the Ancient Overlord has an adaptive defense mechanism; it becomes increasingly resistant to damage from specific weapons or attackers that have previously inflicted damage upon it. This adaptive process, however, can be mitigated by setting the Overlord on fire—a strategy that is strongly advised to maintain offensive effectiveness.

Upon death, the Ancient Overlord may explode, dispersing a large cloud that carries the Viral, COTH, and stacking Poison effects, potentially causing widespread damage even in its final moments. This makes the Ancient Overlord not only a formidable adversary in life but also a dangerous force in defeat, necessitating careful strategic planning to combat effectively.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Ancient Overlord


§f§r§l§nTip:§r

• Before engaging the Ancient Overlord, it's crucial to equip a diverse arsenal of ranged weapons. This strategy is essential due to the Overlord's substantial health pool and its ability to quickly adapt to damage from specific weapons. By utilizing a variety of ranged weapons, you can continuously alter your attack methods, thereby preventing the Overlord from becoming too resistant to any one type of damage.

§l§nThe Ancient Dreadnaut§r stands as one of the two most complex and powerful individual parasites to have evolved. As a flying ranged summoner/tank hybrid, the Dreadnaut operates at a minimum altitude of 7 blocks above the ground, enhancing its strategic positioning. Armed with the ability to fire a series of three projectiles that §ainflict §aWither and spawn an accompanying effect cloud of Wither§r, the Dreadnaut poses a significant threat from a distance. In addition to its formidable ranged attacks, the Dreadnaut can execute powerful swooping maneuvers toward its foes, delivering substantial knockback. This ability enhances its tactical flexibility, allowing it to disrupt enemy formations effectively.

One of the Dreadnaut's most notable abilities is its capacity to summon multiple §cAncient Pods§r. These pods are launched from the sky and, upon landing, explode to inflict 50 damage, apply Saturation -20 for 10 seconds, and release a lingering effect cloud of Poison for 15 seconds. The summoning of these pods is restricted by a cooldown of at least 12 seconds, with no more than 5 pods being active at a time. The pods also serve as a means to §espawn additional parasites such as §eRupters, Manglers, Gnats, and Grunts§r, further compounding the threat posed by the Dreadnaut.

As the Dreadnaut loses health, every 20% reduction triggers the drop of Ancient Tendrils. If these tendrils are not quickly neutralized, they begin to spawn Buglins, signaled by the emission of grey particles. Each tendril boasts 50 HP, adding another layer of defense to the Dreadnaut’s formidable arsenal.

In terms of environmental impact, the Dreadnaut can break almost every type of block, with the sole exception of bedrock, allowing it to reshape battlefields to its advantage. This combination of high-altitude combat, devastating summoning capabilities, and environmental manipulation makes the Ancient Dreadnaut a uniquely challenging foe to contend with.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Ancient Dreadnaut


§f§r§l§nTip:§r

• Before engaging the Ancient Dreadnaut, it's crucial to equip a diverse arsenal of ranged weapons. This strategy is essential due to the Overlord's substantial health pool and its ability to quickly adapt to damage from specific weapons. By utilizing a variety of ranged weapons, you can continuously alter your attack methods, thereby preventing the Dreadnaut from becoming too resistant to any one type of damage.

§l§nThe Deterrent Parasites§r are specialized §eimmobile entities§r that surface from the ground to aid either Beckons or Dispatchers in their defensive strategies. These parasites possess a unique adaptation mechanism, enabling them to become increasingly resistant to specific types of damage over time. As they endure hits from a particular weapon or attacks by a specific mob, they develop heightened resistance to that form of damage, reducing the effectiveness of repeated attacks.

This adaptive capability makes Deterrent Parasites challenging to defeat using conventional tactics. However, their resistance can be mitigated by using fire. Setting the Deterrent Parasites ablaze slows down their adaptation process significantly, making fire-based attacks a crucial strategy in combat. Lighting these parasites on fire not only impedes their ability to adapt but also inflicts ongoing damage, providing a tactical advantage in neutralizing them before they can fully utilize their defensive enhancements.


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Even though Deterrent Parasites are immobile, their strategic importance and defensive capabilities make it essential to address their presence on the battlefield.

§l§nThe Nexus Parasites§r are a specialized group of immobile parasites known for their high adaptability and critical role in spreading the infection to conquer the Overworld. They evolve through §6four stages§r, growing increasingly powerful with each progression. Nexus Parasites are categorized into two types: §2Beckons§r and §4Dispatchers§r, both of which share the ability to adapt when damaged and to release bombs that harm players and create an effect cloud of stacking Viral and Poison.

§l§nBeckons§r are formidable entities within the Nexus Parasites that can be spawned through a Reinforcement System or randomly on areas covered by Residue. They have the capability to §2summon various mobs using Biomass§r. The type of parasites spawned—ground or air—depends on the positional context of the target relative to the summoner, with air types being summoned if the target is at least 3 blocks above the Beckon. Upon their destruction, Beckons also revert any Infested Blocks they created back to gravel covered with Residue, cleansing the immediate area of their prior infl§l§n§ruence.

§l§nDispatchers§r, on the other hand, serve a vital support role and are spawned from a Dispatcher Nidus that has accumulated a certain number of kills. Stage I Dispatchers are equipped with the ability to §9§4store and teleport parasites using Dispatcher Tentacles§r. Any parasites that despawn while stored will return to the Dispatcher's storage. Furthermore, Dispatchers enhance the capabilities of stored parasites by applying various buffing effects. In moments of threat, they can summon Seizers and Sentries for additional defense. Dispatchers also have the unique ability to force nearby Assimilated Mobs to drop their disguises, revealing their true forms, unless the mobs are in water. Right clicking on any of their Dispatcher Tentacle will apply the glowing effect to their Dispatcher, making it easier to find.


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Upon emerging from the ground, Nexus Parasites emit a distinctive sound that can be heard by all players, serving as a crucial alert to their presence. This auditory signal is an important cue to quickly locate and eliminate these parasites before they have the opportunity to evolve to the next stage.

§n§lThe Assimilated Horse§r is a particularly dangerous variant among the Assimilated creatures. Retaining the body of an infested horse, it gains not only heightened aggression but also increased speed and attack range. It is characterized by glowing red pustules that dot its decaying body. Upon death, Assimilated Horses may explode, causing 14 damage within a 3.5 block radius, and releasing Assimilated Remains, 3-4 Buglins, and an effect cloud of stacking §2poison§r and COTH. If they do not explode, there is a 50% chance an Assimilated Horse will drop its head.

§n§rMobs that become Assimilated Horses:
§o§r§o• Horses


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Assimilated Horse§r


§l§nTip§r:

• After defeating an Assimilated Horse, it's crucial to quickly move away from the area. The explosion that can occur upon its death deals significant damage and can be deadly, so maintaining a safe distance immediately after the defeat is essential for survival.

§l§nThe Assimilated Bear§r is the parasitic transformation of a bear. In this monstrous form, the bear's mouth becomes grotesquely enlarged, extending through half of its body, and it grows four additional legs that significantly increase its speed. The Assimilated Bear boasts impressive defensive stats and high damage potential. Upon death, there is a chance that it will explode, releasing Assimilated Remains, 4 Buglins, and an effect cloud of stacking §2poison§r and COTH, adding to its danger even in demise.

§n§rMobs that become Assimilated Bears:
§o§r§o• Polar Bears
• Black Bears
• Grizzly Bears


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Assimilated Bear

§l§nThe Assimilated Big Spider§r is a formidable creature born from the infestation of a Spider-like creature. It features exceptionally long legs that enable it to achieve high speeds, although it lacks robust defensive abilities and stats. This terrifying entity has the ability to shoot projectiles that §7create thin webbing upon impact, which slows down its targets§r; these webs gradually dissipate over time. The Assimilated Big Spider has one variant with half the HP of its normal form. Upon death, there's a chance it will explode in a manner similar to an Assimilated Remains explosion, but with distinctive blue particles and without creating Remain blocks. This explosion releases a cloud of stacking §2poison§r and COTH, and spawns 5 Buglins.

§n§rMobs that become Assimilated Big Spiders:
§o§r§o• Mother Spiders
• Tarantulas


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Assimilated Big Spider

§n§lThe Assimilated Enderman§r is one of the most dangerous Assimilated Parasites. It arises from the corruption of an infested Enderman, gaining significantly enhanced stats such as increased speed—§cfaster than a player§r—and greater damage. Assimilated Endermen possess the unique ability to teleport themselves and nearby Assimilated Mobs according to specific rules: they emit a teleportation noise upon spotting a player, but won’t teleport if within 10 blocks of the target. After teleporting, they will also teleport a nearby Assimilated Mob, inflicting 2 damage to it, unless it’s another Assimilated Enderman. If an Assimilated Enderman is on fire, there's a 75% chance that the mob it teleports will also ignite. Unlike their original counterparts, Assimilated Endermen §9are not weakened by water§r and still, they are immune to ranged attacks, dodging projectiles by teleporting. Upon death, there's a 50% chance an Assimilated Enderman will drop its head, which retains the ability to teleport, but only affects their heads. Assimilated Endermen have a unique variant aside from their normal form: the §dCrawling Variant§r. This version is distinguished by its ability to assume a crawling position, allowing it to fit into spaces just one block tall. This adaptation makes the Crawling Variant particularly tricky to manage, as it can navigate through more confined areas that would typically restrict the movement of larger mobs.

§n§rMobs that become Assimilated Endermen:
§o§r§o• Endermen


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Assimilated Enderman


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Assimilated Endermen are vulnerable to fire when teleporting mobs, a weakness you can exploit. Additionally, they move slower in water than on land, despite not taking water damage. Use these vulnerabilities to your advantage in combat.

§l§nThe Seizer§r is a small but potent Deterrent Parasite that is spawned by Dispatchers across Stages I through IV. Additionally, every type of Pure Parasite, with the exception of the Grunt, assists in the emergence of Seizers from the ground. These parasites play a crucial role in battlefield control by their ability to §4capture and immobilize nearby players or mobs§r. Once in the grasp of a Seizer, the ensnared individual is held in place, unable to move and left vulnerable to further attacks from other enemies until the Seizer is neutralized.

A unique defensive mechanism of the Seizer is its immunity to damage from parasitic projectiles. When hit by such an attack, the Seizer does not sustain damage. Instead, it redirects the impact, applying double the potential damage it would have received to whatever player or mob it currently holds. This ability not only protects the Seizer but also makes it a dangerous priority target that must be dealt with swiftly to free allies from its hold and prevent escalated damage.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Seizer


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Given the Seizer's ability to immobilize and enhance damage to its targets, it is crucial to engage these parasites from a distance. Avoiding close proximity minimizes the risk of being captured and subjected to increased attacks from other enemies.

§n§T§l§nThe Primitive Parasites§r arise from the fusion of four Assimilated Parasites, evolving into a larger and more formidable entity. They naturally spawn starting from Phase Three. Possessing unique abilities, they can adapt gradually to different types of damage through a mechanic known as §dadaptation§r. For instance, repeated arrow strikes result in diminished damage until they become completely immune. However, igniting them hinders their ability to adapt. Furthermore, they can §6break§r through non-resistant blocks like dirt, glass, and sand. In aquatic environments, Primitive Parasites possess the ability to sink below the surface to pursue submerged targets effectively. Additionally, they can execute powerful leaps, allowing them to swiftly navigate through water. These adaptations make them formidable adversaries in underwater encounters. Upon their demise, there's a chance the Primitives will explode, releasing Primitive Remains and creating an effect cloud of stacking §2poison§r and triggering the "COTH" effect.

Primitive Parasites exhibit a unique ability to generate §4§4Orbs§r during combat. These orbs§r are characterized by their red, translucent appearance and swelling "auras." When released, these orbs emit an aura that inflicts §4Exhaustion§r upon nearby players.

They present 3 other variants:
§o• §c§oBerseker Variant§r§o, that inflicts §c§obleeding§r§o effect on hit (red colored)
• §2§oVirulent Variant§r§o, that inflicts §2§oviral§r§o effect on hit and contact (green colored)
• §7§oBreacher Variant§r§o, that can §7§obreak blocks double the Hardness value§r§r§o of their to their Normal Variant (gray colored)


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Engage Primitive Parasites from a distance to mitigate their high damage output. Employ a variety of weapons, particularly those imbued with flames, to counteract their adaptation capability. By using different types of attacks, you can prevent them from fully adapting and maintain your advantage in combat.

§l§nThe Primitive Arachnida§r, resembling spider-like creatures, possess superior stats and abilities compared to the Assimilated Big Spider. They function as versatile units capable of ranged mechanics and melee combat. Their unique feature lies in their §eability to grapple and pull distant mobs or players§r. Upon shooting a white projectile from their mouth, if it misses, a Thin Webbing block will be placed. However, if it hits the target, the Primitive Arachnida will shoot a string from its mouth, attaching it to the target and pulling them towards itself. If the target is within close proximity, the string will disappear, and the Primitive Arachnida will leap to engage in melee combat. They can only pull the target if the projectile successfully hits them. Additionally, they possess the ability to climb blocks and perform small leaps, both on land and in liquids.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Arachnida


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Given their ability to pull enemies towards them, dodging the incoming web projectiles is crucial to avoid being ensnared. It's also advisable to utilize ranged weapons when engaging Primitive Arachnida, allowing you to maintain distance and minimize the risk of being pulled into melee range.

§n§lThe Primitive Yelloweye§r, characterized by its aerodynamic shape and single yellow eye, is a formidable ranged combatant. Its primary method of attack involves shooting poisonous projectiles, which not only inflict the §2poison effect§r for 3 seconds but also degrade gear durability with each shot, reducing it by 4%.

In addition to its standard ranged attack, Primitive Yelloweyes have the capability to launch §2Nades§r, a devastating projectile that creates a block of acid upon impact. This acid inflicts very high damage per second and ignores immunity frames, making it a particularly dangerous threat. The Nade projectile can be identified by its slower travel speed, yellow color, and the presence of flame particles, accompanied by a significantly louder and higher pitched growl.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Yelloweye


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Use ranged weapons and avoid their projectiles.

§l§nThe Primitive Reeker§r stands out among primitives with its four legs and two upper arms, posing a significant threat in melee combat. Renowned for its devastating AoE damage, its §2attacks inflict §2poison§r for 5 seconds upon impact. Particularly formidable is its §6charge attack§r: after remaining stationary for a brief period, the Primitive Reeker charges forward. This assault delivers very high damage per second, ignores immunity frames, and generates substantial knockback and AoE damage.

This charge attack is preceded by flame particles and a noticeably louder and higher pitched growl, serving as a clear telegraph to alert nearby adversaries. Additionally, the Primitive Reeker will briefly pause before executing this maneuver, allowing observant opponents a moment to react and adjust their strategy.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Reeker


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• When a Primitive Reeker comes to a standstill, it's a signal to swiftly move away and prepare to dodge its impending charge attack.

§l§nThe Primitive Bolster§r takes on a cylindrical shape with numerous legs and moves at a relatively sluggish pace. It inflicts damage upon contact. Additionally, it possesses the ability to bestow §dRegeneration II§r (lasting 30 seconds) upon nearby Parasites within a 16-block radius, with a cooldown of 30 seconds.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Bolster


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Given their ability to buff nearby parasites with Regeneration II, prioritizing the elimination of Primitive Bolsters is crucial.

§l§nThe Primitive Manducater§r, resembling a dog-like creature with four short legs and a mouth filled with teeth, is a formidable stealth unit and melee combatant. Its defining feature is its ability to become almost §3completely invisible§r, enhancing its lethality in combat. While in this state, the Manducater's speed is greatly reduced, but its damage output is doubled, making it a deadly threat to unsuspecting targets.

However, this invisibility is removed if the Manducater attacks or is attacked. To activate this ability, the Manducater must have at least 70% of its HP, and once activated, it has a cooldown period of 15 seconds. This mechanic allows the Manducater to strategically ambush prey or escape from dangerous situations by blending into its surroundings and striking with increased potency.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Manducater


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Primitive Manducaters, along with other primitives, have the ability to inflict §7Fear II§r on their targets. This means that even if a Manducater is invisible, the presence of the Fear II effect indicates the possibility that one may be lurking nearby.

§l§nThe Primitive Longarms§r takes on a humanoid form with elongated arms that extend down to its legs. Devoid of a face, its mouth resides within its pierced body. In combat, the Primitive Longarms utilizes a melee attack that inflicts area-of-effect (AoE) damage by swinging its elongated arms.

One of its most formidable abilities is the generation of §4Shockwaves§r—large damaging areas of disturbed ground. After momentarily standing still, the Primitive Longarms summons a Shockwave that moves forward at a slow speed, aiming to break any blocks it contacts. These Shockwaves ignore immunity frames and deliver massive vertical knockback upon impact. The initiation of this attack is telegraphed by flame particles and a higher pitched growl from the Primitive Longarms, giving nearby adversaries a brief warning before it executes the maneuver.

Additionally, the Primitive Longarms' damage output increases as its HP decreases. For every percentage of HP lost, its damage increases by 50%, making it increasingly dangerous as it sustains damage.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Longarms


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• It's best to fight the Primitive Longarms from a safe distance using ranged weapons.

§l§nThe Primitive Vermin§r, resembling a flying parasite with a belly shaped like a mouth and tendrils, is a formidable airborne threat. Its unique feature lies in its ability to release Gnats from its mouth, which descend upon players. 


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Vermin


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• A reliable ranged weapon is needed to tackle the Primitive Vermin from a distance.

§n§lThe Primitive Devourer§r is a fearsome aquatic parasite, relying on its massive tentacles to swiftly traverse water and its formidable mouth to engage in melee combat with opponents. With exceptionally high speed and attack range, they are exclusively capable of traveling through liquids.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Devourer

§l§nThe Primitive Tozoon§r, resembling an elongated worm with a circular mouth filled with teeth, possesses tendrils aiding in attacking and burrowing through the ground. Capable of ambushing prey by §3burrowing underground§r, they become invulnerable while submerged. Additionally, they can teleport while underground, with specific conditions to meet: requiring three full blocks below and above, with a combined hardness value of less than 10. These abilities make the Primitive Tozoon a formidable and elusive adversary, capable of surprising and overwhelming its prey with sudden attacks from below ground.


Task:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Tozoon


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Exploit the vulnerability of the buried Assimilated Tozoon by setting fire to the ground above its location, effectively damaging and weakening it while it remains underground.

§n§lThe Primitive Summoner§r, resembling a crab with four legs positioned on the edge and a rotated mouth without eyes, is a melee combatant endowed with the ability to §bsummon other parasites§r, similar to the Vermin. It can summon 2 Rupters using Biomass, with a 10-second cooldown and a maximum of 4 Rupters active simultaneously. These summoned Rupters spawn with the Rage Effect and are compelled to remain near the Primitive Summoner, regardless of distance. Furthermore, Primitive Summoners possess the ability to §arevive§r fallen parasites if the large Remain piece of the deceased parasite is present.

Task:

§l§4• Kill 1 Primitive Summoner


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Primitive Summoners, in tandem with Primitive Bolsters, represent high-priority targets that should be dealt with swiftly in combat engagements.

§n§lThe Feral Bear§r emerges under specific conditions: either when a Bear is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Bear reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Bear

§n§lThe Feral Horse§r emerges under specific conditions: either when a Horse is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Horse reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Horse

§n§lThe Feral Cow§r emerges under specific conditions: either when a Cow is killed by a Gnat, or when an Assimilated Cow reaches a kill count of 30 and undergoes evolution. This transformation marks a significant escalation in the threat level posed by these creatures.

§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Feral Cow

§l§nThe Inborn Parasites§r represent the purest and most original form of the parasites, having evolved independently over time rather than through the assimilation of other organic bodies. These parasites possess unique abilities, including the capacity to carry other parasites, with their primary objective being to infest as many mobs as possible. Their distinctive characteristics and evolutionary process were the subject of an extensive study by the renowned scientist and doctor, §l§nBlockenheimer§r, during the period of the §l§nCalamity War§r.


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Given that the primary objective of Inborn Parasites is to infest as many creatures as possible, it is crucial to address and manage their presence carefully to prevent widespread infection.

§l§nThe Gnats§r are small, Rupter-like parasites that aggressively pursue their targets and explode upon contact. What sets them apart is their ability to transform any mob they kill into a "§cHijacked Version§r" of that mob. 

They can convert the following mobs:§o
• Cow -> Feral Cow
• Zombie -> Feral Human
• Husk -> Feral Human
• Villager -> Feral Villager
• Archaeologist -> Feral Villager
• Travelling Merchant -> Feral Villager
• Lost Miner -> Feral Villager
• Pig -> Feral Pig
• Sheep -> Feral Sheep
• Horse -> Feral Horse
• Polar Bear -> Feral Bear
• Grizzly Bear -> Feral Bear
• Black Bear -> Feral Bear
• Enderman -> Feral Enderman
• Iron Golem -> Hijacked Golem
• Gold Golem -> Hijacked Golem
• Coolmar Spider -> Heed


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 gnat


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• To effectively combat Gnats, it's crucial to equip a quick-firing ranged weapon or a high-damage melee weapon. These tools will help you swiftly deal with their fast movements and potential threat.

§n§lThe Light Carrier§r is one of two land-based transporting parasites, and it is the weaker variant. It features two sturdy legs that support a container filled with potent §4Gnats and Rupters§r, designed to deploy these smaller, aggressive parasites in combat situations. This structure allows it to effectively move and release its cargo strategically on the battlefield. This unit lacks conventional attack capabilities; instead, it explodes when it gets close to a player, unleashing all the parasites it carries and causing massive damage. The explosion also releases clouds of §2poison§r and COTH, along with a §2viral§r effect. A key vulnerability of the Flying Carrier is fire; §6igniting it prevents the explosion§r, neutralizing its threat before it can release its deadly cargo.

Approximately 33.3% of Light Carriers are variants. Aside from their standard form, Light Carriers have one specific variant known as the §8Empty Variant§r. This version contains no mobs, which allows for faster movement speeds and increased potency of effects. Notably, there is no texture difference between the Empty Variant and the standard Light Carrier, making visual identification challenging.

§n§

§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Light Carrier


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• When dealing with the Light Carrier, it's advisable to equip ranged weapons that can ignite, such as flaming arrows. These weapons exploit the Carrier's vulnerability to fire, allowing you to neutralize its explosive threat from a safe distance.

§n§lThe Buglin§r represents the most basic form of the parasite. It begins as a simple, worm-like entity that poses no direct threat through aggression. Instead, §dits presence alone can spread the COTH effect to those nearby§r. As they mature, §bBuglins transform into Rupters§r, which represent their adult form. This evolution marks a significant change in their appearance and potentially in their behavior as well.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 buglin


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• It's crucial to prevent Buglins from getting close to your passive mobs because they can infest them. Despite not posing a direct threat, it's advisable to eliminate Buglins as soon as you spot them to avoid any potential risks associated with their infestation.

§l§nThe Mangler§r is an evolved form of the Rupter, emerging after achieving 30 takedowns. This creature is larger, faster, and boasts improved overall stats. Its melee attacks inflict §7Slowness IV§r on targets, and it is capable of performing significant leaps. Additionally, Manglers execute regular evasive dashes, signaled by blue, enchanted hit particles. They also demonstrate agility in liquids with the ability to perform small leaps and dive to pursue submerged targets. A unique trait of the Mangler is its §6adaptation§r ability to grow resistant to damage from repeated attacks from the same weapon or mob; the more hits it takes from a particular source, the less damage it receives from that source. However, this adaptive process can be mitigated by setting the Mangler on fire, a tactic that is highly recommended to counter its resilience.

They present 2 other variants:
§o• §c§oBerseker Variant§r§o, that inflicts §c§obleeding§r§o effect on hit (red colored)
• §2§oVirulent Variant§r§o, that inflicts §2§oviral§r§o effect on hit and contact (green colored)


§l§n§4§l§nTask:

§r§4• Kill 1 Mangler


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Manglers are just as efficient in packs as they are alone, making them formidable opponents under any circumstances. Therefore, it is crucial to equip yourself with proper gear before engaging them to ensure you can handle their capabilities effectively.

§n§lThe Heavy Carrier§r is the largest and most formidable of the transporting parasites. It ambulates on three short, robust legs and is equipped with large containers that hold a deadly assortment of parasites, including §4Rupters, Gnats, and Primitive Yelloweyes§r. This design allows it to transport and deploy significant numbers of these aggressive entities, making it a critical threat in any land-based encounter. This unit lacks conventional attack capabilities; instead, it explodes when it gets close to a player, unleashing all the parasites it carries and causing massive damage. The explosion also releases clouds of §2poison§r and COTH, along with a §2viral§r effect. A key vulnerability of the Heavy Carrier is fire; §6igniting it prevents the explosion§r, neutralizing its threat before it can release its deadly cargo.

Approximately 33.3% of Heavy Carriers are variants. Aside from their standard form, Heavy Carriers have one specific variant known as the §8Empty Variant§r. This version contains no mobs, which allows for faster movement speeds and increased potency of effects. Notably, there is no texture difference between the Empty Variant and the standard Heavy Carrier, making visual identification challenging.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Heavy Carrier


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• When dealing with the Heavy Carrier, it's advisable to equip ranged weapons that can ignite, such as flaming arrows. These weapons exploit the Carrier's vulnerability to fire, allowing you to neutralize its explosive threat from a safe distance.

§n§lThe Worker§r is a unique parasitic mob distinguished by its non-aggressive behavior towards players. It resembles the Rupter in appearance and agility but utilizes its capabilities for construction rather than combat, specifically focusing on building Colonies. Unlike other parasitic entities, the Worker does not spread the COTH infection, which made it a subject of interest for the renowned doctor and scientist §l§nBlockenheimer§r. He kept one personally in his room to study it closely with the aim of understanding its biology and potentially finding a cure for the parasitic infection.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Worker

§l§nThe Sentry§r is a formidable immobile Deterrent Parasite that specializes in long-range combat to target its enemies. Summoned by Stage III Beckons and both Stage III and IV Dispatchers, the Sentry is strategically placed to provide a strong line of defense. Its primary mode of attack involves firing a burst of three poisonous projectiles, which pose a significant threat not just to the health of its targets but to their equipment as well.

The corrosive nature of these projectiles is particularly dangerous as they can rapidly degrade player armor. §aEach hit from these projectiles reduces the durability of an armor piece by 4%§r, compounding the damage with each successive hit. Additionally, the poison inflicted by these projectiles lasts for 7 seconds, further exacerbating the threat by continuously damaging the player over time. This makes the Sentry a critical asset in defensive setups for parasites, necessitating careful and strategic engagement to avoid severe armor damage and health depletion.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Sentry

§l§nThe Kyphosis§r is a robust and tanky immobile parasite, specifically summoned to defend Stage III Beckons. It serves as a formidable frontline defender, utilizing its melee attack to deal significant damage. The attack involves the Kyphosis stabbing its target with a whip-like point, delivering massive knockback and §6area-of-effect (AoE) damage§r to disrupt enemy lines and push back assailants.

In addition to its powerful melee capabilities, the Kyphosis can also §9generate §9Waves — small, damaging areas of disturbed ground§r that move rapidly towards the target. These Waves are unique in that they home in on targets at high speed but cannot traverse upward over blocks, limiting their reach to level ground. The damage inflicted by these Waves is considerable, as they deal very high damage per second and ignore immunity frames, ensuring that each hit is effectively felt.

The activation of this ability is clearly indicated by the appearance of flame particles and a loud clicking sound, alerting nearby players and parasites to the impending attack. This combination of close and ranged combat abilities makes the Kyphosis a critical element in the defensive strategy around Stage III Beckons, requiring coordinated tactics and careful planning to overcome.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Kyphosis


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• Given the fact that the Kyphosis is melee and immobile, they can easly be killed using ranged projectiles.

§l§nThe Beckon Stage I§r has the ability to summon the following Parasites:§o

• Rupter


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Beckon Stage I

§l§nThe Beckon Stage II§r has the ability to summon the following Parasites:§o

• Rupter
• Assimilated Parasites
• Aloe
• Heartdemon
• Patrolman
• Flying Carrier (air)
• Kyphosis
• Heed
• Light Carrier


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Beckon Stage II

§l§nThe Beckon Stage III§r has the ability to summon the following Parasites:§o

• Rupter
• Primitive Parasites
• Feral Parasites
• Warden
• Vigilante
• Aloe
• Heartdemon
• Patrolman
• Flying Carrier (air)
• Overseer (air)
• Light Bomber (air)
• Kyphosis
• Heed
• Light Carrier
• Sentry
• Crux

§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Beckon Stage III

§l§nThe Beckon Stage IV§r has the ability to summon the following Parasites:§o

• Beckon Stage I
• Beckon Stage II
• Beckon Stage III
• Ancient Overlord
• Ancient Dreadnaut

§rStarting from Phase 5, Stage IV Beckons distinguish themselves from other stages by their ability to generate a §cNode, which in turn can create a Parasite Biome§r. This advanced capability allows Stage IV Beckons to play a pivotal role in expanding parasitic influence by transforming the environment itself.

Additionally, Stage IV Beckons possess a unique evolutionary power that allows them to instantly §aupgrade any parasite below the Adapted Tier§r, bypassing the usual evolutionary steps required within the system. This ability to accelerate parasite evolution is marked by a dramatic, albeit non-damaging, lightning strike, signifying the transformation. Specifically, this power converts any Assimilated Mobs or Walking Heads into Primitive Parasites, and any Primitive Parasites into Adapted Parasites, effectively enhancing their capabilities and roles within the parasitic hierarchy.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Beckon Stage IV


§r§n§lTip:§r

• The large green Biomass bulb on top of the Stage IV Beckon functions as a Weak Point. When this Weak Point is hit, damage inflicted to it is tripled and the Bleeding Effect is applied to it.

§l§nThe Dispatcher Stage I§r will apply the following effects to parasites once they're stored:§o

• Debar I (1:40)
• Link I (3:20)
• Heightened Senses I (1:40)


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Dispatcher Stage I

§l§nThe Dispatcher Stage II§r will apply the following effects to parasites once they're stored:§o

• Speed I (3:20)
• Regeneration II (3:20)
• Debar I (3:20)
• Link I (5:00)
• Heightened Senses II (3:20)


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Dispatcher Stage II

§l§nThe Dispatcher Stage III§r will apply the following effects to parasites once they're stored:§o

• Speed II (5:00)
• Regeneration III (5:00)
• Strength III (5:00)
• Debar I (5:00)
• Link II (6:40)
• Heightened Senses III (5:00)


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Dispatcher Stage III

§r§l§nThe Dispatcher Stage IV§r will apply the following effects to parasites once they're stored:§o

• Speed III (6:40)
• Regeneration IV (6:40)
• Strength IV (6:40)
• Absorption IV (6:40)
• Debar I (6:40)
• Link III (8:20)
• Heightened Senses IV (6:40)
§r
Stage IV Dispatchers have the capability to summon multiple §6Ancient Pods§r, which dramatically descend from the sky toward the ground. After a brief period post-landing, these pods detonate, dealing 50 damage and dispersing a Toxic Cloud that reduces Saturation by 20 for 10 seconds, as well as an effect cloud of Poison that lasts for 15 seconds. Unlike pods from other stages, those released by a Stage IV Dispatcher do not spawn additional parasites, focusing instead on direct damage and area denial.

From Phase 4 onwards, Stage IV Dispatchers gain the additional ability to§b generate Colonies§r, expanding their influence and fortifying their presence within an area.


§l§n§4§n§lTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Dispatcher Stage IV


§r§n§lTip:§r

• A critical vulnerability of the Stage IV Dispatcher is the topmost flower on its structure, which serves as a Weak Point. Strikes to this particular part cause triple the normal damage and trigger the Bleeding Effect, making it a strategic target for attackers seeking to quickly neutralize this formidable foe.
