betterquesting:10.desc:8:
To survive, you uncover the ancient art of §l§nTinkering§r, a craft once mastered by the §l§nArcane Villagers§r to combat their relentless natural predators: The Parasites. These early inhabitants forged their finest weapons, tools, and armor with a blend of creativity, imagination, and a touch of magic. Through their ingenuity, they endured the harsh realities of this world for generations. By embracing their legacy and honing the skills of Tinkering, you too can carve out a path to survival and thrive in this unforgiving land.


To begin your path, craft and use the following items in this sequence:

§eStencil Table:§r Insert a Blank Pattern and select the desired shape.

§ePart Builder:§r Place the Shaped Pattern and a material (e.g., stone) to create your first Part.

§ePattern Chest:§r Store your Shaped Patterns inside.

§eTool Station:§r Combine the previously made Parts to create various Weapons and Tools.

§eArmor Station:§r Combine the previously made Parts to create different Armor sets.


§b§l§nSmithing Master Perks:§o

§r§o• XP Rewards;
• Tinker's Construct Knowledge
• Items for progression§r
Create a §b§lBroadsword§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lPickaxe§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lShovel§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lHatchet§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lMattock§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lKama§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lShortbow§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lLongsword§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lRapier§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lFrypan§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create a §b§lBattlesign§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create an §b§lArrow§r inside the Tool Station (any material).
Create some §b§lBoots§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lChestplate§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create some §b§lLeggings§r inside the Armor Station (any material).

§lRefer to the two manuals in your inventory for comprehensive details. §r

Using the Forge, you can create a §6wider variety of Tools and Weapons§r. Additionally, you can apply §aModifiers§r to enhance your existing items.
Create a §b§lCrossbow§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lBolt§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lLongbow§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lScythe§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lLumberaxe§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lExcavator§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lHammer§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lCleaver§r inside the Armor Station (any material).
Create a §b§lShuriken§r inside the Armor Station (any material).

§lRefer to the two manuals in your inventory for comprehensive details. §r

Gather the necessary materials to build a §9§lSmeltery§r, which allows you to forge Parts using stronger materials like Iron, Gold, and Manyullyn.

§6Seared Bricks:§r The main material for the furnace. Use the Bricks to build the walls of the Smeltery, ensuring the interior is a 3x3 space. The height can vary.

§6Smeltery Controller:§r Replace a Seared Brick with the Controller. Clicking on it allows you to insert ingots into the Smeltery.

§6Seared Tank:§r Replace a Seared Brick with the Tank. Fill it with lava by right-clicking it with a lava bucket, providing fuel for the Smeltery.

§6Seared Drain:§r Replace a Seared Brick with the Drain.

§6Seared Faucet:§r Attach it to the Seared Drain's round hole.

§6Casting Table:§r Place it under the Seared Faucet. Right-clicking the Faucet will pour molten materials onto the Table.

Create a §b§lHammer Head Cast§r.

Just like the Part Builder, the Smeltery uses Casts to create Tool Parts, and these casts can be made out of gold. To create a Hammer Head Cast, follow these steps:

1. Build a Hammer Head from any material in the Part Builder.

2. Place the Hammer Head on the Casting Table at the Smeltery.

3. Insert 2 Gold Ingots into the Smeltery by right-clicking the Smeltery Controller and wait for them to melt.

4. Right-click the Faucet and let the gold solidify. Once the Cast is ready, right-click to retrieve it.

Create the Parts for a §lForged Hammer§r.

1. §9Cobalt Hammer Head:§r Mining blocks increases your speed as long as you keep mining. Cobalt is found in the Nether.

2. §cArdite Large Plate:§r Your tool absorbs stone for durability. Ardite is found in the Nether.

3. §eElectrum Large Plate:§r Upon mining a number of blocks, your tool gets charged, granting Haste for a short period. Get Electrum by mixing Silver and Gold in the Smeltery.

4. §6Bronze Tough Tool Rod:§r The tool lasts longer when it has less durability. Get Bronze by mixing Copper and Tin in the Smeltery.

Combine the Parts to create the Hammer. Modify it with §bDiamond§r and §9Luck III§r.

1. §9Luck III:§r This means Fortune. Put the Hammer into the Tool Forge and combine it with 360 Lapis Lazuli.

2. §bDiamond:§r Greatly improves Durability and Mining Speed. Put the Hammer into the Tool Forge and combine it with 1 Diamond.

§lCongratulations! You made your first Advanced Tool!

Your long and harsh journey has equipped you with essential skills in automation, energy manipulation, and metalworking. With newfound cleverness, you learn another way to confront your lethal enemies, just as the average working people did before they were eradicated by the §l§nCalamity War§r. Now, you have the knowledge to create §l§nfabrics, guns, turrets, and other industrial machines§r, empowering you to face the challenges ahead with ingenuity and resilience.


To begin this trait, craft the §6§lEngineer's Hammer§r, the most important item from the mod. Using the Hammer, you can modify metal ingots by turning them into plates and also activate machines.


§6§l§nIndustrial Technology Perks:§o

§r§o• XP Rewards;
• Immersive Engineering Knowledge
• Items for progression§r

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details. §r

Gather the materials for the §b§r§b§lCoke Oven§r. By using the Oven, you'll be able to obtain Creosote Oil from burning Coal. Simply place empty buckets and the fuel (such as coal blocks or logs) inside, wait for the process to complete, and you're good to go.

To build the Coke Oven, follow these steps:

1. Obtain 27 Coke Bricks.

2. Arrange the Coke Bricks in a filled 3x3x3 cube.

3. Right-click the structure with an Engineer's Hammer to complete the construction.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§c§lBlast Furnace§r. By using the Furnace, you'll be able to obtain Steel Ingots by melting Iron Ingots using Coal Coke. It works like a normal furnace, but you can only use Coal Coke as fuel.

To build the Blast Furnace, follow these steps:

1. Obtain 27 Blast Bricks.

2. Arrange the Blast Bricks in a filled 3x3x3 cube.

3. Right-click the structure with an Engineer's Hammer to complete the construction.
Create a §b§lHelmet§r inside the Armor Station (any material).

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details. §r

Craft the §b§r§a§lEngineer's Workbench§r. This crafting table functions like a standard one but supports special recipes. To unlock a specific recipe, place the associated blueprint into the Workbench.

Craft the §9§lBlueprint§r for §lCrafting Components§r.

This unlocks the following recipes:

-> Iron Mechanical Component
-> Steel Mechanical Component
-> Vacuum Tube
-> Circuit Board

Craft the §9§lBlueprint§r for §lMetal Press Molds§r.

This unlocks all types of Metal Press Molds.

Craft the §9§lBlueprint§r for §lCommon Projectiles§r.

This unlocks the following recipes:

-> Casull Cartridge
-> Armor-Piercing Cartridge
-> Silver Cartridge
-> High-Explosive Cartridge
-> Buckshot Cartridge 

Fired using a Revolver, they're very efficient against Primitive and Adapted Parasites.

Craft the §9§lBlueprint§r for §lArc Furnace Electrodes§r.

This unlocks the following recipe:

-> Graphite Electrode

Craft the §9§lBlueprint§r for §lSpecialized Projectiles§r.

This unlocks the following recipes:

-> Dragon's Breath Cartridge
-> Phial Cartridge
-> Flare Cartridge

Fired using a Revolver, they're very efficient in various situations. The Dragon's Breath Cartridge can kill Pure Parasites.

Craft the §9§l§a§lRevolver§r. It's one of the most effective weapons against Adapted and Pure Parasites. You can load up to 8 Cartridges by using Shift + Right Click. To shoot, simply press Right Click.

Craft the §e§lChemical Thrower§r. A highly effective weapon against groups of Parasites. It uses burning liquids like Biodiesel and Lava as fuel. 

To fill the weapon, place the liquid into a Wooden or Metal Barrel, then Right Click on the Barrel with the weapon.
To shoot, switch to attack mode by pressing Shift + Right Click, then hold Right Click.

Craft a §e§lFurnace Engine§r. It is the essential component required to craft your initial air vehicle: the Plane or Helicopter. 

Additionally, these vehicles can be crafted and customized using different types of wood sources. To operate them, Coal is used as fuel.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.

§rCraft your first energy source. A §6§lWindmill§r, a §b§lWater Wheel§r or a §a§lThermoelectric Generator§r. In order to draw power from them, §nplace the generators on the hole of a Kinetic Dynamo§r (except for the Thermoelectric Generator). 

§lHow to make basic circuits:§r

1. §n§aHV, MV, LV:§r This is a property that shows how much energy flows through a circuit.
HV -> High Voltage, MV -> Medium Voltage, LV -> Low Voltage.

2. §n§aWire Coils:§r The energy passes through them. Can be connected on certain blocks that affects energy, for example, a Powered Lantern, Relay or Wire Connector.

3. §n§aWire Connectors:§r Used to draw or supply power to specific blocks. To use them, place a Wire Connector on a block (e.g., an MV Wire Connector on an MV Capacitor). Then, place another Wire Connector of the same type on a Kinetic Dynamo. Right-click the first Wire Connector with a Wire Coil of the same type, followed by right-clicking the second Wire Connector with the Wire Coil. This sets up a basic circuit.

4. §n§aRelays:§r Similar to Wire Connectors but cannot supply or draw power from blocks. They consolidate multiple Wire Coils from various Wire Connectors into a single Wire Coil with increased energy flow.


Once your setup is complete, use your §l§c§lEngineer's Hammer§r to configure blocks to accept or reject power. For example, with a Capacitor, right-click its top side. If it's blue, it accepts power (input); if orange, it rejects power (output). To supply power to a Capacitor, connect the Wire Connector to the designated blue side you've set up.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.

§rCraft your first §9§lCapacitor Backpack§r and fill it with RF Power. Then, equip the Backpack in your Body Bauble Slot.
This setup allows you to continuously draw energy into the §2§lRailgun§r that you'll craft next. The Railgun uses Rods as projectiles, with the Graphite Rod being the most powerful. To shoot, hold Right-Click to charge the gun, then release the button to fire. This weapon is highly effective against Adapted Parasites. §nYou can also apply a Precision Scope to the Railgun using the Workbench.§r

How to charge the Backpack?

Craft a §e§lCharger (tier I, II, III)§r and connect it to an energy source using a Wire Connector. Then, place your Backpack in the Charger and wait for it to charge.

§lOR§r

Craft a §e§lCharging Station§r and connect it directly to the energy source (the wire goes directly into the device).

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.

§rCraft a type of §a§lConveyor Belt§r. These belts are used to transport dropped items, similar to real-life factory conveyor systems.
There are several types of Conveyor Belts:

1. §eNormal, Vertical, and Splitting Conveyor Belt:§r Used to move items from one place to another.

2. §cDropping Belt:§r Placing this belt on top of a storage block (e.g., Chest, Hopper, Crate) allows items that land on it to enter the block, functioning like a Hopper.

3. §9Extracting Belt:§r When placed on the side of a storage block, it extracts items from the block's inventory.


You can also adjust the orientation of blocks using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details. §r

Gather the materials for a §b§lLiquid Tank§r, used to store up to 512 liquid buckets. You can use Pipes to transfer liquids in or out.

To build the liquid tank, follow these instructions:

1. Place 4 Treated Wood Fences in the corners of a 3x3 square.

2. In the middle of the 3x3 square, place an Iron Sheetmetal Block.

3. Above the square (on top of the fences), create a chamber with dimensions of 3x3x4 (width x length x height)

4. Right Click with the §lEngineer's Hammer§r on the building to finish.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.

§rCraft a §4§lTesla Coil§r, one of the most dangerous defensive mechanisms. It automatically shoots you and other mobs within range, dealing significant damage. Its attacks also apply a stun effect that prevents teleporting. To become immune to its attacks, wear Faraday Armor and put the Tesla Coil into Low-Power Mode using Shift + Right Click with the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

To power the Tesla Coil, connect it to an energy source. It can also be configured to require a Redstone signal to activate or set to automatic mode (Inverted). Use the §lEngineer's Hammer§r to switch between these modes.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§c§lReinforced Blast Furnace§r. In addition to the standard Blast Furnace, this upgraded version features enhanced input and output mechanisms, and supports Preheaters. Preheaters accelerate furnace operations and can be placed on its sides. They require energy to function effectively.

To build the Reinforced Blast Furnace, follow these steps:

1. Obtain 27 Reinforced Blast Bricks.

2. Arrange the Reinforced Blast Bricks in a filled 3x3x3 cube.

3. Place a Hopper in the center of the top side of the cube.

4. Right-click the structure with an Engineer's Hammer to complete the construction.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§b§lMetal Press§r. This multiblock is used to shape metal ingots into various forms such as Rods, Plates, and more. To operate the machine, it must be powered with energy. Setting up the desired shape for the ingot involves crafting a Mold corresponding to that shape. Use the Mold by right-clicking on the piston to configure the furnace. Once set up, simply drop the metal ingots onto the Conveyor Belts to initiate the shaping process. To retrieve the Mold, Shift + Right Click it with the Engineer's Hammer.

To build the Metal Press, follow these steps:

1. Place a Redstone Engineering Block with two Steel Scaffoldings on opposing sides.

2. On the Redstone Engineering Block, place a piston facing downwards.

3. On the Piston, place a Heavy Engineering Block.

4. On the top side of each Steel Scaffolding, place a Conveyor Belt. The belts have to face the same direction.

4. Right Click on the Heavy Engineering Block with the Engineer's Hammer.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§b§lAssembler§r. It serves a unique function by registering crafting recipes. It operates using energy as an Autocraft Machine where materials for a recipe are inputted via belts (items) or pipes (liquids). The multiblock then assembles these materials according to the registered recipe and outputs the finished product.

Refer to the Engineer's Manual for detailed instructions on building the Assembler. After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§b§lCrusher§r. When powered using energy, it converts metal ingots §n(or other items, such as Blaze Rods)§r in their dust version.

Refer to the Engineer's Manual for detailed instructions on building the Crusher. After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§9§lSqueezer§r. When powered using energy, it can convert plant seeds into Plant Oil that can be collected through Pipes. Also, it converts §nCoal Coke into HOP Graphite Dust§r.

Refer to the Engineer's Manual for detailed instructions on building the Squeezer. After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§a§lMixer§r. When powered using energy, it mixes different solid items combined with Water (or other liquid) in order to create various types of liquids (e.g. Liquid Concrete or Potions).

Refer to the Engineer's Manual for detailed instructions on building the Mixer. After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§a§l§4§lFermenter§r. When powered using energy, it converts different types of fruits (Apple, Melon, Potato, Sugar Cane) into Ethanol.

Refer to the Engineer's Manual for detailed instructions on building the Fermenter. After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§6§lRefinery§r. This heavy machinery works on energy and has its unique purpose to mix two liquids into another (e.g. Ethanol + Plant Oil = Biodiesel). It uses two inputs and one output for Pipes.

Refer to the Engineer's Manual for detailed instructions on building the Refinery. After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§d§lArc Furnace§r. Being one of the biggest multiblock machines in the modpack, it resembles the most efficient furnace, melting stacks after stacks of items in a couple of seconds. Also, it can double ores. In order to operate, it needs energy and Graphite Electrodes. 

Refer to the Engineer's Manual for detailed instructions on building the Arc Furnace. After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.
 §r
Gather the materials for the §b§r§a§l§4§l§2§lExcavator§r. It is the most advanced machinery designed to collect various types of minerals (e.g., Coal, Gold, Iron) that players cannot mine directly.

How does it operate?

To activate the Excavator, you need to power it with energy. Additionally, it must be placed in a chunk that contains mineral deposits, otherwise, it will not function as there will be nothing to mine.

How can I see where mineral deposits are?

1. Craft a §9§lCore Sample Drill§r.

2. Place the Core Sample Drill in a chunk and power it with energy.

3. Right-click the Core Sample Drill to start the sampling process.

4. After the animation stops, right-click it again to obtain a Core Sample.

5. The Core Sample will indicate if there is a mineral vein in the chunk.

6. If a mineral vein is found, that chunk is ideal for building the Excavator. It will then start automatically mining the ores from the detected mineral vein.

Refer to the Engineer's Manual §nthird page§r for detailed instructions on building the Excavator. §nThe Wheel of the Excavator has to be two blocks underground.§r After completing the construction according to the manual, Right Click on it using the §lEngineer's Hammer§r.

§l§nThe Assimilated Dragon§r represents the peak of Assimilation. It is the most powerful Assimilated Parasite, surpassing the Primitives, Adapteds, and Pures. This formidable entity can be found in The End Dimension when the Phase is 3 or above. Although it cannot adapt to damage like other Assimilated Parasites, it possesses compensatory abilities: §5it can fly very high, shoot projectiles, and deal extremely high damage§r. Additionally, it has a chance to §6drop its Living Head after death§r. The head itself cannot fly, but it remains very powerful. It is strongly advisable to equip yourself with the best gear, as you will be §cfacing a Preeminent-like Parasite§r.


§l§4§l§nTask:

§l§4• Kill 1 Assimilated Ender Dragon


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• You are not safe in the air.

Get your first §a§lIndustrial Hemp Fiber§r. This fiber is essential for creating more advanced textiles and fabrics in your crafting projects.

To obtain the Industrial Hemp Fiber, follow these steps:

1. Find Industrial Hemp Seeds by breaking grass.

2. Plant the seeds and allow them to grow.

3. Harvest the fully grown plants to collect the Industrial Hemp Fiber.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details. §r

Craft a §e§lGarden Cloche§r, a device designed to accelerate plant growth and multiply their products. To operate the Garden Cloche, you need to supply it with both energy and water. Inside, there are two main inputs: the bottom input is for the required soil, and the top input is for the seed of your choice (e.g., Dirt + Seed).

Get 3 §c§lGunpowder Barrels§r. These barrels are primarily used for mining, as they create controlled explosions that do not destroy dropped blocks. You can use them in a chain to create large holes underground efficiently.

Craft the §4§lShip's Node§r. The Ship's Node is one of the most advanced items for survival and exploration. It combines parasite's core parts into the §nConcentrated Parasitic Substance§r, giving "life" to the blocks around it. The primary function of the Ship's Node is to create §bAircrafts, Vessels, and Submarines§r manually built by the player, similar to normal constructions.


§e§nHow to Build a Vehicle Using the Ship's Node:§r

1. Construct Your Ship:

2. Gather the blocks of your choice and construct a ship in any desired shape.

3. Place the Ship's Node. Position the Ship's Node at the desired control point. This will serve as your steering wheel.

4. Separate Your Building. Place Sticky Buffer Blocks between your ship and any surrounding structures to prevent the Ship's Node from connecting your ship with other blocks.

5. Fuel the Vehicle. Install up to 4 Steam Engines. These operate like furnaces and require coal for power.

6. (Optional) Place a Passenger Seat into the Vehicle. It allows other players (or creatures) to mount while it is moving.

7. Assemble the Ship. Right Click on the Ship's Node and select "Assemble Ship." If everything is in order, click on "Mount Ship."


§e§nHow to Build a Vessel:§r

1. Construct on Water. Build your structure on the water's surface. Place some Sticky Buffers under it, to make it float more efficiently.

2. Follow the Vehicle Steps.

3. Use WASD to move and Shift to disassemble and unmount.


§e§nHow to Build a Submarine:§r

1. Follow the Vessel Steps. Remove all Sticky Buffers (this is only for the Submarine. If not removed, it'll not submerse).

2. Enable Submarine Mode. While mounted, press Ctrl + K and select "Don't Submerse Ship." You're ready to submerge.

3. Use WASD to move, Shift to disassemble and unmount, X to ascend, and Z to descend.


§e§nHow to Build an Aircraft:§r

1. Construct the Aircraft. Follow the Vehicle Steps.

2. Include Balloon Blocks. Ensure that more than 50% of your structure consists of Balloon Blocks.

3. Assemble and Mount. Complete the assembly and mounting process.

4. Use WASD to move, Shift to disassemble and unmount, X to ascend, and Z to descend.


§4§lIMPORTANT:§r§4
Do not disassemble and unmount your vehicle when blocks overlap with tile entities, such as grass. Doing so will drop you off the vehicle without properly unmounting it.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.

§rCraft a §4§lGun Turret§r, a very good choice when it comes of defending against Adapted Parasites. It uses different types of §eCartridges as Projectiles§r in order to shoot the living creatures that you configure. It doesn't shoot the player.

To power the Gun Turret, connect it to an energy source. It can also be configured to require a Redstone signal for activation or set to automatic mode (Inverted). Use the §lEngineer's Hammer§r to switch between these modes.

§lRefer to the Engineer's Manual in your inventory for comprehensive details.

§rCraft a §4§lChemthrower Turret§r, a very good choice when it comes of defending against large groups of Parasites, such as Hordes. It uses different types of §eFlammable Liquids, such as Ethanol§r in order to shoot the living creatures that you configure, in the way that the Chemical Thrower does. In order to make it deal damage, select the "Ignite Fluid" button from the turret's interface. It doesn't shoot the player.

To power the Gun Turret, connect it to an energy source. It can also be configured to require a Redstone signal for activation or set to automatic mode (Inverted). Use the §lEngineer's Hammer§r to switch between these modes. Also, connect the Liquid Sources through Pipes.

§b§lThe Basic Turrets§r are the first defense mechanisms you will craft, and all require energy to operate.

§nThere are two types of Basic Turrets:§r

§6Open Modular Turrets:§r These turrets are inexpensive but less effective. They are very efficient in casual situations, such as facing Assimilated Parasites. To operate, these turrets must be placed on a Turret Base. They cannot be powered directly; instead, you need to charge the Turret Base.

§6Immersive Turrets:§r These turrets are more expensive but also more effective, capable of killing Adapted Parasites. Unlike the Open Modular Turrets, they can be powered directly using cables and connectors.

Craft a §4§lDisposable Item Turret§r, one of the best turrets for the early game. It's very handy when you don't have enough resources for advanced projectiles and is good for defending the base against Assimilated Parasites.

To power the Disposable Item Turret, place it on a §6Turret Base (Tier 1)§r. Right-click on the Base and place some basic blocks §e(e.g., Cobblestone) there. They'll work as projectiles§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §4§lPotato Cannon Turret§r. It's a very good option if you have large potato crop fields. It works like any other Open Modular Turret but §euses potatoes as projectiles.§r It's very handy when you don't have enough resources for advanced projectiles and is good for defending the base against Assimilated Parasites.

To power the Potato Cannon Turret, place it on a §6Turret Base (Tier 1)§r. Right-click on the Base and place some potatoes there. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

You keep building massive machines, learning more about your surroundings and how to control nature to your advantage. As you look at the industrial mechanisms you've created, you think, §l§n"§l§nThey're not fast enough..."§r Determined to improve, you start researching ways to make your factories more efficient. You study advanced technology, physics, and engineering, gradually surpassing the workers who lived before the §l§nCalamity§r. With your new skills, you become like those who fought against it, using modern automation, advanced machinery, and innovative ideas to turn your operations into a modern industrial powerhouse.


To start your technology evolution, craft the §9§lMetallurgic Infuser§r, the first machine you need. It is essential for creating advanced crafting components, such as Reinforced Alloys and Control Circuits, by combining multiple ores. It operates using energy.


§c§l§nAdvanced Technology Perks:§o

§r§o• XP Rewards;
• Mekanism Knowledge
• Items for progression§r

Craft the §c§lCrusher§r. Its primary role is to pulverize metal ingots into their corresponding dust items. It operates when connected to an energy source. The produced metal dusts are crucial for various advanced crafting recipes, such as §nJetpacks.

Build the §6§lEnrichment Chamber§r. Once powered, it can purify dirty dusts or even produce multiple dusts from a single ore block. For instance, you can §ndouble your iron ingots§r by mining iron ores with Silk Touch, placing them into the Enrichment Chamber, and then smelting the resulting dusts in a furnace.

By placing a Crystal Seed, you can accelerate the process of obtaining its "Pure" form more quickly.

Construct the §b§lEnergized Smelter§r. It represents an upgrade from the traditional furnace by utilizing energy instead of fuel items for its operation. Additionally, it benefits significantly from Speed upgrades.

Construct the §e§lPrecision Sawmill§r. This machine block is designed to manipulate wood, such as converting logs into 6 planks or transforming fences into sticks. It also produces Sawdust as a common byproduct, which can be used to create paper. This device operates using energy.

Craft the §3§lOsmium Compressor§r. When powered up using energy, it combines Osmium with Glowstone Dust or with Refined Obsidian Dust in order to make Glowstone Ingots or Refined Obsidian Ingots. Very useful in advanced crafting recipes.

Craft the §9§lCombiner§r. Its primary function is to merge ore products into their ore blocks when energized (e.g., converting 3 emeralds into an Emerald Ore). This is beneficial for generating more ores, allowing them to be further §nmultiplied in the Purification or Injection Chambers§r.

Craft the §d§lPurification Chamber§r. Its primary purpose is to convert each ore into 3 Clumps. When further processed, each Clump can be transformed into its respective ingot, allowing you to triple your ore output by using this energy-powered machine block.

Craft the §a§lChemical Injection Chamber§r. It functions similarly to the Purification Chamber, but the key difference is that the Chemical Injection Chamber generates 4 Shards instead of 3 Clumps. Each Shard can be further processed into a Clump, and each Clump can be transformed into its respective ingot, allowing you to quadruple your ores. This machine operates using energy.

Upgrade a machine block to its relative §9§lBasic Factory§r. The Basic Factories have §n3 slots instead of one§r and they work with energy,


§nA Factory can be applied on the following machine blocks:§r

1. Metallurgic Infuser

2. Crusher

3. Osmium Compressor

4. Combiner

5. Precision Sawmill

6. Energized Smelter

7. Enrichment Chamber

8. Purification Chamber

9. Chemical Injection Chamber.

Upgrade a machine block to its relative §e§lAdvanced Factory§r. The Advanced Factories have §n5 slots§r and they work with energy,


§nA Factory can be applied on the following machine blocks:§r

1. Metallurgic Infuser

2. Crusher

3. Osmium Compressor

4. Combiner

5. Precision Sawmill

6. Energized Smelter

7. Enrichment Chamber

8. Purification Chamber

9. Chemical Injection Chamber.

Upgrade a machine block to its relative §2§lElite Factory§r. The Elite Factories have §n7 slots§r and they work with energy,


§nA Factory can be applied on the following machine blocks:§r

1. Metallurgic Infuser

2. Crusher

3. Osmium Compressor

4. Combiner

5. Precision Sawmill

6. Energized Smelter

7. Enrichment Chamber

8. Purification Chamber

9. Chemical Injection Chamber.

Craft the §3§lConfigurator§r. This essential tool is invaluable for modifying the functionality of a machine block. To begin with, each side of a machine block can have multiple functions:

§4§r3.§4 Input:§r This allows it to accept items, fluids, and gases. For instance, by connecting a pipe to one of its Input sides, the machine block can intake water.

§1§r2.§1 Output:§r This enables the machine to eject items, fluids, and gases. By connecting a pipe to one of its Output sides, the machine block can dispense liquids.

§2§r1.§2 Energy:§r This option lets you configure sides that accept energy.

You can configure each property of a machine block side through its menu under the "Side Config" tab by clicking on each square that represents a side of the cube. Additionally, if you want the items to be ejected automatically, simply select the "Auto-eject" button from the same menu.
The Configurator can be used to set up your machine block externally by holding the tool and then using Shift + Right Click on a side to alter its properties.

Craft a §6§lBasic Transmitter§r. This device is designed for transferring energy, items, fluids, and gases through various types of conduits. They connect just like the redstone dust and can be placed anywhere. Their properties and functionality can be modified using the §nConfigurator§r. As their tier increases, their efficiency improves significantly.

There are several types of transmitters:

1. §eUniversal Cable:§r Used for energy transmission.

2. §ePressurized Tube:§r Employed to exchange gases.

3. §eMechanical Pipe:§r Utilized for liquid transfer.

4. §eLogistical Transporter:§r Designed for item transportation.

5. §eThermodynamic Conductor:§r Used for heat transmission.

Craft an §c§lAdvanced Transmitter§r. This device is designed for transferring energy, items, fluids, and gases through various types of conduits. They connect just like the redstone dust and can be placed anywhere. Their properties and functionality can be modified using the §nConfigurator§r. As their tier increases, their efficiency improves significantly.

There are several types of transmitters:

1. §eUniversal Cable:§r Used for energy transmission.

2. §ePressurized Tube:§r Employed to exchange gases.

3. §eMechanical Pipe:§r Utilized for liquid transfer.

4. §eLogistical Transporter:§r Designed for item transportation.

5. §eThermodynamic Conductor:§r Used for heat transmission.

Craft an §b§lElite Transmitter§r. This device is designed for transferring energy, items, fluids, and gases through various types of conduits. They connect just like the redstone dust and can be placed anywhere. Their properties and functionality can be modified using the §nConfigurator§r. As their tier increases, their efficiency improves significantly.

There are several types of transmitters:

1. §eUniversal Cable:§r Used for energy transmission.

2. §ePressurized Tube:§r Employed to exchange gases.

3. §eMechanical Pipe:§r Utilized for liquid transfer.

4. §eLogistical Transporter:§r Designed for item transportation.

5. §eThermodynamic Conductor:§r Used for heat transmission.

Craft an §d§lUltimate Transmitter§r. This device is designed for transferring energy, items, fluids, and gases through various types of conduits. They connect just like the redstone dust and can be placed anywhere. Their properties and functionality can be modified using the §nConfigurator§r. As their tier increases, their efficiency improves significantly.

There are several types of transmitters:

1. §eUniversal Cable:§r Used for energy transmission.

2. §ePressurized Tube:§r Employed to exchange gases.

3. §eMechanical Pipe:§r Utilized for liquid transfer.

4. §eLogistical Transporter:§r Designed for item transportation.

5. §eThermodynamic Conductor:§r Used for heat transmission.

Craft every machine block that §9§loperates using Fluids and Gasses§r. Fluids and gasses signify different states of matter, each with their own unique properties. Fluids can be transported through Mechanical Pipes, whereas Gasses are conveyed using Pressurized Tubes.

Examples of fluids include: §bWater§r, §bLava§r
Examples of gasses include: §bHydrogen§r, §bOxygen§r

§nBoth Gasses and Fluids are managed by the following machine blocks:§r

1. §eRotary Condensator:§r Used to convert gases into liquids and vice versa. For example, it can convert water vapor into liquid water or liquid water into water vapor.

2. §eChemical Oxydizer:§r Used to convert solid materials into their gaseous forms.

3. §eChemical Infuser:§r  The Chemical Infuser is used to combine two different gases to create a new gas. For instance, it can combine Hydrogen Chloride and Deuterium to produce Tritium.

4. §eElectrolytic Separator:§r Uses electricity to split certain liquid compounds into their gaseous components. For example, it can separate water into Hydrogen and Oxygen gases, which are used in various other machines and processes within Mekanism.

5. §eChemical Dissolution Chamber:§r Used to dissolve ores into a slurry using sulfuric acid. This slurry can then be further processed into clean slurry in the Chemical Washer, significantly increasing the yield of processed ores.

6. §eChemical Washer:§r Cleans the slurry produced by the Chemical Dissolution Chamber, turning it into a clean slurry. This process is a part of the ore refining chain in Mekanism, which improves the output of processed ores.

7. §eChemical Crystallizer:§r Takes clean slurry from the Chemical Washer and crystallizes it into crystals. These crystals are then used in various other processes or can be smelted into ingots, improving ore processing efficiency.

8. §ePressurized Reaction Chamber (PRC):§r Used for various complex chemical reactions that require both gases and solid or liquid reactants. An example reaction is combining Hydrogen, Biofuel, and Water to produce Ethylene.

Craft an §6§lEnergy Tablet§r. This essential crafting component is vital for modern §nMekanism Generators§r. Furthermore, it acts as a portable energy storage (battery), making it useful in emergency situations.

The modern Mekanism Generators represent the pinnacle of advanced technology, capable of producing energy much faster than their industrial predecessors. To transfer the energy, they must be connected to §nUniversal Cables§r.

Craft the §c§lHeat Generator§r. It produces energy from heat sources such as lava, coal, and other burnable items. It can also passively generate energy from adjacent heat sources like lava blocks, making it a versatile and early-game power option.

Craft the §b§lWind Generator§r, one of the most popular type of generator. It harnesses the power of wind to generate electricity. It works best when placed at higher altitudes, where wind strength is greater. The Wind Generator is a renewable energy source that can produce power day and night, provided it is placed in an optimal location.

Craft the §e§lSolar Generator§r. It converts sunlight into electrical energy. It is a renewable energy source that works best during the day when exposed to direct sunlight. The Solar Generator stops producing power at night or when it is obstructed by blocks or bad weather.

Craft the §6§lAdvanced Solar Generator§r. This generator is an upgraded version of the §nSolar Generator§r, providing significantly more power. It consists of multiple solar panels arranged in a more efficient design. Like the basic Solar Generator, it requires direct sunlight to operate and is more efficient in clear weather.

Craft the §3§lGas-Burning Generator§r. The machine produces energy by burning various types of gases, such as §nEthylene§r. It is highly efficient and can produce a large amount of power when supplied with the right type of gas, making it suitable for mid-to-late-game energy needs.

Craft the §2§lBio-Generator§r. It generates power from §nBiofuel§r, which can be produced from organic materials like plant matter, seeds, and certain food items. It is a renewable energy source ideal for players who have automated farming systems.

Craft your first and most advanced mechanical multi-functional pet: the §6§lRobit§r. This loyal companion can easily be killed by virtually any threat. Its primary purpose is to assist you with daily tasks inside your base: §nit incorporates a chest, crafting table, and anvil§r. However, it requires a §a§lChargepad§r to recharge with energy.


§nHow to spawn it:§r

1. Craft the Robit§r.

2. Craft a Chargepad§r and place it down.

3. Set the Robit§r on the Chargepad and wait for it to charge.

4. Right-click the Robit§r and toggle its follow mode.


§aThe Chargepad:§r Its main function is to charge items that are placed on top of it. The best example is the Robit§r. Additionally, you can charge other equipped items, such as a §nCapacitor Backpack§r, simply by standing on the Chargepad.


IMPORTANT: If your §6§lRobit§r is "killed," it will stop following you. To resolve this, carry the §6§lRobit§r and place it near your Chargepad. Then, destroy and replace the Chargepad.

The §b§lAdvanced Turrets§r represent the next generation of base defense. These turrets are designed to protect your home even in the highest Phases, effectively dealing with Adapted, Pure, and even Preeminent Parasites. They are composed of Open Modular Turrets, which need to be placed on a charged Turret Base to function properly.

§nList of the Advanced Turrets:§r

1. Rifle Turret (Tier II)

2. Incendiary Turret (Tier II)

3. Grenade Launcher Turret (Tier III)

4. Relativistic Turret (Tier III)

5. Teleporter Turret (Tier IV)

6. Rocket Launcher Turret (Tier IV)

7. Laser Turret (Tier V)

8. Rail Gun Turret (Tier V)

Craft 2 §6§lQuantum Entangloporters§r, one of the most advanced energy transport mechanisms. Its primary use is to transfer wireless energy by connecting two Quantum Entangloporters on the same frequency.

§nHow to operate?§r

1. Place your first Quantum Entangloporter§r connected to an energy source. This unit needs the side energy config set to Input and Auto-Eject: ON. Name a frequency (e.g., "LINE 1") and then click on "Set."

2. Place your second Quantum Entangloporter§r, ensuring its side energy config is set to Output and Auto-Eject: ON. Set the same frequency you chose earlier (e.g., "LINE 1"), and you're all done. You have successfully connected two Entangloporters on the same frequency.

Craft a §9§lIncendiary Turret§r, one of the most effective turrets for eliminating large groups of parasites. This turret can shoot area-of-effect (AOE) flaming projectiles over a short range, allowing it to decimate entire swarms of Assimilated, Feral, and even Primitive Parasites.

To power the Incendiary Turret, place it on a §8Turret Base (Tier 2)§r. Right-click on the Base and fill it with §eBlazing Clay (projectiles)§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §9§lRifle Turret§r, an excellent defensive mechanism designed to combat flying parasites like Yelloweyes. This turret boasts an impressive shooting range of 35 blocks and inflicts significant damage on targets, making it a formidable addition to your base defense strategy.

To power the Rifle Turret, place it on a §8Turret Base (Tier 2)§r. Right-click on the Base and place some §eBullets (projectiles)§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §9§lGrenade Launcher Turret§r, a highly destructive turret designed for eliminating large groups of enemies. This turret is formidable, similar to the Incendiary Turret, but boasts a longer range, making it exceptionally effective at decimating swarms of parasites from a distance. Its explosive firepower ensures robust defense for your base against threats.

To power the Grenade Launcher Turret, place it on a §eTurret Base (Tier 3)§r. Right-click on the Base and fill it with §eGrenades (projectiles)§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §9§lRelativistic Turret§r, a highly specialized §nUtility Turret§r. Unlike other turrets that fire projectiles and deal damage, this turret slows down enemies, effectively stunning them and making it easier for your defenses to handle threats. Its unique abilities make it a valuable addition to your base's security system.

To power the Relativistic Turret, place it on a §eTurret Base (Tier 3)§r. It doesn't need to be filled with anything§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §9§lTeleporter Turret§r, a highly advanced §nUtility Turret§r. Similar to the Relativistic Turret, it does not require any ammunition to damage surrounding enemies; instead, it utilizes sophisticated mechanics. The Teleporter Turret occasionally teleports nearby enemies on top of itself, effectively immobilizing them and making it easier for your defenses to manage threats. 

To power the Teleporter Turret, place it on a §bTurret Base (Tier 4)§r. It doesn't need to be filled with anything§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §9§lRocket Launcher Turret§r, the ultimate defensive mechanism designed for massive destruction. Its homing rockets deal significant area-of-effect (AOE) damage, making it capable of annihilating groups of Adapted Parasites with ease. This turret is a powerful asset for anyone looking to bolster their base's defenses against overwhelming threats.

To power the Rocket Launcher Turret, place it on a §bTurret Base (Tier 4)§r. Right-click on the Base and fill it with §eRockets (projectiles)§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §9§lLaser Turret§r, a powerful defensive mechanism that primarily relies on energy, conserving other resources since it does not use any projectiles for firing. Additionally, it boasts a very high attack speed and damage output, making it exceptionally effective against Adapted Parasites and weaker threats.

To power the Laser Turret, place it on a §T§5Turret Base (Tier 5)§r. It doesn't need to be filled with anything. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft a §9§lRail Gun Turret§r, the most powerful turret designed specifically for dealing with High Tier Parasites. Although it has a slow attack speed, its immense damage output can significantly harm even the most formidable Preeminent Parasites. This turret serves as a crucial tool for managing and controlling Parasite Biomes, as well as being highly effective in defending your base against overwhelming threats.

To power the Rail Gun Turret, place it on a §T§5Turret Base (Tier 5)§r. Right-click on the Base and fill it with §eFerro-Magnetic Slugs (projectiles)§r. The last step is to connect the Turret Base to a power source and charge it with energy.

Craft the §6§lAtomic Disassembler§r, a highly advanced tool that utilizes energy instead of durability. You can recharge it by standing on the §nChargepad§r or by placing it in the §nTiered Chargers§r.

The Atomic Disassembler serves multiple functions, earning its classification as a multitool. It can mine like a pickaxe, dig like a shovel, chop like an axe, and attack like a sword. Each of these actions consumes a portion of energy, making it a very efficient tool for daily tasks.

Additionally, it has the capability to mine ore veins. To control and set up this feature, use Shift + Right Click. The following options are available: §n§bOFF, SLOW, NORMAL, FAST, and VEIN§r.

Craft the §c§lFlamethrower§r, an excellent weapon for defending against large groups of Adapted Parasites (and lower tiers). It boasts a larger attack range than the Chemical Thrower and consumes less fuel. The Flamethrower operates using Hydrogen, which counts as its durability. To recharge the Flamethrower, provide it with access to Hydrogen by placing it in the §6Electrolytic Separator§r and waiting for it to fill up with Hydrogen.

§nYou can switch the Flamethrower to multiple modes using the Shift + APOSTROPHE keys:§r

1. §4Inferno§r -> Used to set things on fire.

2. §6Heat§r -> Used to generate heat, capable of breaking wood blocks and turning sand into glass.

3. §eCombat§r -> The main mode for engaging enemies.

Craft the §a§lJetpack§r, an incredibly useful tool for combat and structure exploration. Its primary function is to accelerate vertically (along the Y axis), allowing you to soar into the sky in a very short time. This feature is especially beneficial for escaping parasites or climbing tall buildings. However, it is not the best choice for transportation, as it lacks high forward speed.

Its primary fuel source is Hydrogen, which can be charged in an §6§lElectrolytic Separator§r, just like the Flamethrower. To equip the Jetpack, place it in the Chestplate slot. Despite its low armor rating, you can upgrade it to an Armored Jetpack for added protection.

§nYou can switch the Jetpack to multiple modes using the Shift + X keys:§r

1. §4Disabled§r

2. §2Regular§r -> Standard vertical movement, using SPACE to propel yourself.

3. §3Hover§r -> Locks into the current position, allowing only forward or backward movement.

Craft the §b§lThirst Quencher§r. This gadget is your go-to solution for overcoming the thirst mechanic, as it automatically replenishes your thirst bar simply by being in your inventory or bauble slot. To operate, the Thirst Quencher requires energy and water to consume.


§nHow to fill the Thirst Quencher?§r

Hold it in your hand and right-click on a water source.


§nHow to charge the Thirst Quencher?§r

Craft a §e§lCharger (tier I, II, III)§r and connect it to an energy source using a Wire Connector. Then, place your Thirst Quencher in the Charger and wait for it to charge.

§lOR§r

Craft a §e§lCharging Station§r and connect it directly to the energy source (the wire goes directly into the device).

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Gather the materials for the §b§r§d§lAlloy Kiln§r. This machine serves a similar purpose to the Tinker's Smeltery, allowing you to combine two different materials to create a new one. It functions like a furnace with two input slots where you can use different metals. With the Alloy Kiln, you can easily produce §nElectrum, Constantan, and Bronze ingots§r. To operate it, power the Kiln using Coal or any other burning fuel.

To build the Alloy Kiln, follow these steps:

1. Obtain 4 Kiln Bricks.

2. Arrange the Kiln Bricks in a 2x2x2 cube.

3. Right-click the structure with an Engineer's Hammer to complete the construction.

As you venture through treacherous terrain, struggling to survive, you stumble upon a cluster of glowing, otherworldly ores. Their luminescent glow and enigmatic patterns hint at a power beyond your comprehension. Instinctively, you sense these mysterious crystals are not to be ignored. They seem almost §l§nalien§r, as if they’ve traveled from a distant realm to reveal their secrets.

To unlock the hidden potential of these crystals, begin by gathering a §b§lCertus Quartz Crystal§r. Your journey with these crystals may change the course of your adventure, unveiling powers you never imagined.

§l§nForeign Technology Perks:§o

§r§o• XP Rewards;
• Applied Energistics Knowledge
• Items for progression§r

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Craft one of the §b§lTrash Cans§r. Their main functionality is to void matter and get rid of it forever.


§nThere are four types of Trash Cans:§r

1. §8Item Trash Can§r, which disposes of unwanted items.

2. §9Fluid Trash Can§r, designed to get rid of excess fluids

3. §cEnergy Trash Can§r, which voids surplus energy.

4. §5Ultimate Trash Can§r combines the capabilities of all three, providing the most efficient disposal solution.

Craft a §6§lMeteorite Compass§r. This advanced tool helps you locate hidden meteorites scattered throughout the deep and dark caves of the world. These ancient meteorites contain valuable crafting components crucial for progressing with the mod.

The Compass points in the direction of the meteorites. Follow that direction until the needle starts spinning rapidly in a circle, indicating that a meteorite is hidden in the current chunk. Dig down until you discover a §nhuge black pile of Sky Stones§r.

Create a §5§lFluix Crystal§r. This evolved type of Certus Crystal is formed by combining §nRedstone Dust, Nether Quartz, and Charged Certus Quartz Crystal§r. To create it, gather these materials and drop each one, one by one, into the water. This process will yield 2 Fluix Crystals.

The Fluix Crystal is crucial for the advancement of alien technology due to its remarkable conductive properties. For example, it is used to craft special cables that operate with "AE" type energy.

Craft a §8§lQuartz Grindstone§r along with its §e§lWooden Crank§r. This machine block is incredibly useful for crafting ore dust from various types of ores. The primary function of the Quartz Grindstone is to produce Fluix Dust and Certus Quartz Dust, which can be utilized in different crafting recipes.

To operate the Quartz Grindstone, place the block down with the Wooden Crank on top of it. Next, insert an ore into the Grindstone and right-click on the Wooden Crank to begin spinning it. Continue to spin the Wooden Crank until the ore is transformed into its corresponding dust.

Craft a §d§lVibration Chamber§r. This device serves as your first source of AE energy. It can only be transferred through Fluix Cables, making it a reliable option specifically for alien technology. Note that this generator cannot be connected to standard industrial mechanisms, as they do not accept AE energy.

To operate the Vibration Chamber, use it similarly to a normal furnace that has only the fuel input. You can use Coal and Coal Blocks as fuel sources.

Craft a §a§lCrystal Charger§r. This machine block is designed exclusively to §nconvert Certus Quartz Crystal into its "charged" variant§r. It can be powered by any type of energy, although AE energy is recommended for its lower consumption. To operate the machine, power it up and right-click on it with a Certus Quartz Crystal. After a few seconds, you can collect the §bCharged Certus Quartz Crystal§r.

Craft a §5§lCrystal Growth Accelerator§r. This simple mechanism allows you to §ncreate Certus Quartz, Nether Quartz, and Fluix Crystal in their "Pure" form§r. These Pure Crystals are essential components for more advanced crafting recipes. The Crystal Growth Accelerator exclusively accepts AE energy.


§nHow to create Pure Crystals?§r

1. Place a Vibration Chamber and activate it using fuel. The Crystal Growth Accelerator must be charged with energy, preferably using Blocks of Coal.

2. Construct a small room with 1 block of space filled with water, similar to the provided picture.

3. Replace one of the walls of the room with the Crystal Growth Accelerator.

4. Connect the Vibration Chamber to the Crystal Growth Accelerator using Fluix Cables. Ensure that the Fluix Cable is connected to the bottom of the Crystal Growth Accelerator for proper operation.

5. Craft one of the §eCrystal Seeds §e(Certus Quartz, Nether Quartz, or Fluix)§r.

6. Throw the seed into the water as demonstrated in the picture and wait for it to grow. Once it is fully developed, the item will disappear, but you can still collect it by approaching the water source.

Craft the §d§lGun Workbench§r, a specialized block designed to help you create advanced firearms tailored for combating parasites at higher phases. The Gun Workbench functions similarly to a Crafting Table, but it offers a unique interface that displays the model of the gun and its addons, allowing you to scroll through all available options. Each firearm can have attachments, such as Scopes and Silencers. To attach them, combine the gun and the accessory in a Crafting Table. Additionally, each type of gun uses a different kind of ammo as its projectile.


§nHere are multiple types of guns you can craft:§r

1. §aAssault Rifle (Basic Ammo)§r: A classic weapon for common combat scenarios. It features a medium-high fire rate and medium damage, making it effective against small groups of parasites.  
§r  
2. §aRifle (Advanced Ammo)§r: With a very low fire rate, this weapon excels at long-range combat, delivering extremely high damage.  
§r  
3. §aShotgun (Shell)§r: Similar in damage and fire rate to the Rifle but effective only at short distances. Ideal for countering surprise attacks.  
§r  
4. §aPistol (Basic Ammo)§r: Suitable for taking down single targets with a medium fire rate and damage.  
§r  
5. §aMachine Pistol (Basic Ammo)§r: Not craftable using the Workbench, but can be found in the Laboratory. It serves the same purpose as the Pistol but features low damage and a high fire rate.  
§r  
6. §aMinigun (Basic Ammo)§r: Functions like the Machine Pistol but boasts high durability and can fire continuously over long periods. It's great for handling large groups, such as hordes.  
§r  
7. §aGrenade Launcher (Grenade)§r: Deals significant explosive damage with a low fire rate. Effective for taking out groups of Medium Tier Parasites.  
§r  
8. §aBazooka (Missile)§r: Offers extremely high damage and accuracy, perfect for eliminating large hordes or High Tier Parasites.  
§r

Obtain an §c§lInscriber Press§r. In order acquire the item you have to locate ancient meteorites buried deep underground. These Inscriber Presses are remarkable pieces of technology, crafted from materials that are far beyond the current understanding and capabilities of modern technology. They play a crucial role in sophisticated crafting processes, particularly for creating printed components using a specialized machine known as the §nInscriber§r.

Craft the §a§lInscriber§r. It represents an advanced piece of machinery designed exclusively for printing crafting components using Inscriber Presses. It has the capability to operate with various types of energy, making it versatile in its applications. The Inscriber plays a crucial role in enhancing crafting processes, allowing for the efficient creation of complex parts and components essential for more sophisticated machinery and systems.

§nHere are the following components that can be crafted using the Inscriber:§r

1. §7Printed Calculation Circuit:§r Inscriber Calculation Press + Pure Certus Quartz Crystal

2. §bPrinted Engineering Circuit:§r Inscriber Engineering Press + Diamond

3. §ePrinted Logic Circuit:§r Inscriber Logic Press + Gold Ingot

4. §8Printed Silicon:§r Inscriber Silicon Press + Silicon

Furthermore, by combining Circuits with Printed Silicon and Redstone Dust (see recipes in JEI), you can craft their corresponding Processors.

Craft the §e§lME Controller§r, the brain of your advanced AE circuit. This device can power up to §n8 channels§r and is compatible with any type of energy. It's important to note that the connection between the ME Controller and the blocks it manages must be established using Fluix Cables.

§nWhat is an AE circuit?§r

The AE circuit is a multiblock system featuring a powered ME Controller that connects to various sources known as "channels" via Fluix Cables. Examples of these channels include the ME Terminal, ME Chest, and ME Drive. Each side of the ME Controller that the cables connect to constitutes a separate circuit. This allows the ME Controller to support up to 6 distinct circuits, with each circuit capable of managing 8 separate channels.

In the quest illustration, you'll find an example showcasing a ME Controller connected to 2 circuits: one supports 3 channels, while the other supports 1 channel.

Craft a §9§lME Drive§r and a §9§lME Terminal§r. These advanced blocks work together to provide a storage solution comparable to a chest with virtually unlimited capacity. For them to function in harmony, they must be connected to a §nME Controller§r, and the orientation of the connections is irrelevant; you can attach three Drives to one side of the Controller and the ME Terminal to another.


§5ME Drive:§r The ME Drive serves as the storage hub, capable of holding Storage Cells of various tiers (1k, 4k, 16k), indicating how many items each cell can accommodate. You can insert up to 10 Storage Cells into a single Drive.


§dME Terminal:§r The ME Terminal must be powered with AE energy from the Circuit to access the items stored in the Drive. When you interact with the ME Terminal, a chest-like interface appears, allowing you to input and output items from the Storage Cells housed within the Drive. Additionally, there is a variant known as the §cME Crafting Terminal§r, which includes a Crafting Grid, merging the functionalities of a Chest and a Crafting Table.

Craft a §4§lME Chest§r. This advanced block combines the functionalities of both the §nME Drive and ME Terminal§r, providing a compact storage solution that can hold one Storage Cell. To operate effectively, the ME Chest must be integrated into an AE Circuit, ensuring seamless interaction within the system. It offers a user-friendly interface for inputting and outputting items, making it an essential component in any advanced storage setup.

Craft the §6§lEnergy Cell§r. This essential component is designed to store AE energy for future use, functioning similarly to Capacitors. Energy Cells efficiently capture and hold energy, ensuring that your machinery operates smoothly and without interruptions.

Additionally, these cells can be upgraded into §nDense Energy Cells§r, which significantly enhance their energy storage capacity. Incorporating Energy Cells into your setup will help maintain a stable energy supply, optimizing the performance of your advanced technological systems.

Craft the §5§lME IO Port§r. The ME IO Port is an essential component used for transferring data between ME Storage Cells and the network. This allows you to efficiently manage your stored items by moving data in and out of storage cells. Using the ME IO Port simplifies organizing and accessing your resources, making your storage system more streamlined and accessible.

§nHow to Use:§r

Place the ME IO Port within your ME network setup. Insert a filled ME Storage Cell into the input slot to transfer data to the network. Place an empty ME Storage Cell into the output slot to transfer data from the network onto the cell. This process helps keep your ME storage organized and efficient.

Craft the §1§lME Interface§r. The ME Interface is a versatile block that allows your ME Network to interact with external inventories. It can import and export items, making it a key component for automating crafting processes and managing resources efficiently. By using the ME Interface, you can connect various machines and storage systems to your ME Network.

§nHow to Use:§r

Place the ME Interface on a machine or inventory. Configure its settings to specify which items to import or export. This helps automate tasks and integrates your entire storage and crafting system seamlessly.

Craft the §b§lME Storage Bus§r. The Storage Bus is an interface that connects external inventories to your ME Network, allowing the network to access items stored in chests, barrels, and other storage units. This is particularly useful for managing large inventories and integrating various storage systems into one cohesive network.

§nHow to Use:§r

Place the Storage Bus on any inventory block you want to connect to the ME Network. Configure the storage settings to specify item priorities and filters, such as setting higher priorities for rare materials, using filters to control which items can be stored, and using whitelist/blacklist to include or exclude specific items. This will ensure efficient item management and seamless integration into your ME system.

Craft the §4§lAnnihilation Plane§r and §5§lFormation Plane§r. These planes are essential components for managing item flows in and out of your ME Network. The Annihilation Plane is used to break blocks and collect items directly into the network, while the Formation Plane places items from the network into the world, allowing for automated construction and item deployment.

§nHow to Use:§r

Place the §4Annihilation Plane§r on a block face where you want to collect items automatically. It will break blocks or collect dropped items into the ME Network.

The §5Formation Plane§r should be placed where you want items to be deployed. Configure it to specify which items to place and set patterns for item placement. This setup allows for efficient automation of item collection and deployment within your network.

Craft the §d§lCell Workbench§r. The Cell Workbench is a critical tool used to manage and configure your ME Storage Cells. It allows you to partition storage cells, setting specific storage limits and preferences for different types of items, which helps in organizing and optimizing your storage system effectively.

§nHow to Use:§r

Place the Cell Workbench in your network setup. Insert a storage cell and configure the partitions by specifying the types and quantities of items it should store. This helps maintain an organized and efficient ME Network by ensuring items are stored according to your preferences.

Craft the §9§lView Cell§r. The View Cell is a useful component for managing your ME Network, allowing you to filter and view specific items stored within your ME System. It helps in organizing and accessing specific subsets of your stored items efficiently.

§nHow to Use:§r

Insert the View Cell into an ME Terminal or ME Chest. Configure it by selecting the items you wish to filter and view. This enables you to quickly access specific items from your vast storage, making inventory management more streamlined and efficient.

Craft the §6§lWireless Terminal§r, §4§lSecurity Terminal§r, and §3§lWireless Access Point§r. These components are essential for creating a wireless ME Network, allowing remote access to your storage system.

§nHow to Use:§r

§6Wireless Terminal:§r Used for remote access to your ME Network. Link it to your network via the Security Terminal.

§4Security Terminal:§r Manages network access and secures wireless connections. Place it in your network and link your Wireless Terminal to it.

§3Wireless Access Point:§r Extends the range of your Wireless Terminal. Place it within your network to cover desired areas. §nWireless Boosters can be added to the §nWireless Access Point§r to increase the range, allowing for greater coverage and flexibility in accessing your ME Network remotely.

Create the §c§lSingularity§r. The Singularity is a crucial item used in advanced crafting recipes, particularly for the§n Quantum Link Chamber§r, which enables the linking of ME Networks over long distances. It is also used in various other high-end crafting recipes.

§nHow to Use:§r

To create a Singularity, you need a §eMatter Condenser§r. Place the Matter Condenser in your network and set it to "Condense into Singularities." Insert a storage cell and feed it materials until it reaches §n256,000 items§r. The Matter Condenser will then produce a Singularity, which you can use in advanced crafting recipes.

Gather the materials to build a §3§lQuantum Network Bridge§r. The Quantum Network Bridge enables long-distance and interdimensional connections between ME Networks, facilitating seamless integration and resource management across vast distances.


§nBuilding the Quantum Network Ring:§r

1. Arrange 8 Quantum Rings in a 3x3 configuration, creating a hollow square frame.

2. Place the Quantum Link Chamber in the center of the frame.


§nCreating 2 Quantum Entangled Singularities:§r

1. Drop 2 Ender Pearl Dusts and 1 Singularity in one place.

2. Explode them using any kind of TNT.

3. Collect the two Quantum Entangled Singularities.


§nBuilding the Quantum Network Bridge:§r

1. Build 2 Quantum Network Rings at a considerable distance from one another.

2. Inside each Quantum Link Chamber, place a Quantum Entangled Singularity. Ensure the Singularities were created from the same explosion to connect the Rings.

3. Power the rings using a considerable amount of AE energy.

4. The network should function like a normal one, with only one ME Controller. Connect the rings through Fluix Cables to establish the link.

Gather the materials to build a §5§lTeleportation Bridge§r. This structure represents the most advanced technology known by humanity, still being into an experimental state. This allows for instant travel between distant locations within your Minecraft world, making transportation of players more efficient.


§nBuilding the Teleportation Station:§r

1. Arrange §aTeleporter Frames§r in a 3x4 "n" configuration, leaving a hollow bottom-center.

2. Place a §bTeleporter§r in the bottom of the multiblock to make a "0" shape.


§nCreating the Teleportation Bridge:§r

1. Build two Teleportation Stations at distant locations.

2. Ensure both Teleporter are connected to sufficient power sources.

3. Link the Teleporters by setting their frequencies to the same value.


§4§lIMPORTANT:
§r§4To keep the Teleportation Bridge working, both Teleportation Stations have to be into loaded chunks. To ensure that is happening, equip each Teleporter with an §nAnchor Upgrade.

After an intense battle with the mobs generated by the Mob Spawner, you finally emerge victorious and break the spawner. However, the relief is short-lived as a strange smell wafts from the remnants. It’s the scent of death, but unlike the odor of parasites, this one feels more... "pure." It carries the essence of honorable death.
Yet, this smell must originate from something. You realize that the spawner must have contained a concentrated form of mob soul to facilitate the spawning. After a moment of contemplation, you arrive at a curious conclusion: §nPerhaps you can also create spawners§r.

§2§l§nSpawning Tactician Trait Perks:§o

§r§o• Vanilla Mob Spawners


§r§2§l§nTask:§r

§2• Consume (eat) 1 Skull of Creation§r

§l§nHow to Get a Mob Spawner:§r

§l1.§r Use the §b§nSoul Reaper§r to defeat a mob. This will drop its Essence§r.

§l2.§r Gather enough Mob Essence to create its corresponding Mob Spirit§r.

§l3.§r Locate a Mob Spawner§r and break it with a Silk Touch Pickaxe§r to obtain an Empty Spawner§r.

§l4.§r Place the Empty Spawner and Right-Click it with the Mob Spirit to complete the process.


§r§2§l§nTask:§r

§2• Acquire 1000 Zombie Essence

By crafting the §5§lBook of Skills§r, you unlock one of the core principles of Arcane mastery: §l§nskill traits§r. For centuries, the Villagers of Arcanya have relied on this technique for survival and prosperity. Skill knowledge embodies a form of body art, derived from the acquisition of hidden ancient theories intertwined with experience. These theories are scattered throughout the world in the form of §l§n"Scrolls"§r, waiting to be discovered. 


§n§lThe Book of Skills works like a book with its own GUI and features the following:§r

§l1. Skills:§r Level up your unlocked Skill Traits using XP.

§l2. Abilities:§r The Book of Skills can include an Anvil, a Crafting Table and an Enchanting table. Each be unlocked using special Scrolls.

§l3. XP Bank:§r Store your personal XP. Won't be lost on death.


§5§l§nArcanya's Scrolls Trait Perks:§o

§r§o• XP Rewards;
• Mystical Items;
• Scrolls;
• Skill traits knowledge§r


§5§n§lTask:

§r§5• Craft the Book of Skills

§l§nMana Crystal:§r

The Mana Crystal represents the most important item when it comes to the management of mana. Consuming a Mana Crystal increases your maximum mana (forever) and replenishes your Mana Bar by half. Very useful in combat, when using special types of Baubles.


§5§n§lTasks:

§r§5• Get 45 Mana Candies
• Craft 8 Glowing Ingots

Your hand just touched the mysterious bioluminescence of a Mana Candy. Energy pulses through your skin, creating a sensation of both heat and cold. Further study reveals that the Mana Candy is a key reason life persists on this planet. The Arcane Villagers harness mana magic to bend reality to their will, creating mystical and seemingly impossible items known as "baubles."


§n§lMana Candy:§r

A hidden Mana Bar lies within you, waiting to reveal itself when the time is right. This mana is used by certain advanced baubles to activate their abilities, such as breathing dragon fire or flying. The Mana Candy is fundamental to this process. Consuming a Mana Candy replenishes your Mana Bar by a small amount, making it very useful in combat. Also, it serves in more advanced arcane recipes. Can be found inside the Ancient Structures of Arcanya.

• Craft 4 Glowing Ingots

This mystical and advanced block operates like a regular Enchanting Table but with enhanced features. When an item is placed, all possible enchantments become available simultaneously. Additionally, you can apply multiple enchantments to the weapon in succession. Each enchantment

The "Arcane Rupter" is a very rare variant of the Rupter, distinguished by its vibrant yellow color pattern due to a high concentration of infused energy. This variant is notorious for consuming a significant number of Arcane Villagers. When attacked, the Arcane Rupter employs a defensive mechanism by expelling water from its body.

This powerful bauble embodies the purest form of mana, offering both defensive and offensive capabilities. It can dodge attacks, stun enemies, and unleash extremely powerful electrified mana burst shots dealing §5850 damage§r. However, all these abilities require a tremendous amount of mana to execute.

§n§T§l§nThe Assimilated Parasites§r are the final result of a COTH infestation. After a period of being infested, the affected mob transforms into a more monstrous version of itself. These creatures are highly aggressive upon detection, exhibiting moderate speed and damage. They continue to spread the COTH effect either by proximity to other mobs or by attacking them directly.

When an Assimilated Parasite is defeated, it may react in one of several ways: it might explode, dispersing COTH further; drop its living head, which is as agile and weak as a Rupter, or simply perish without any additional consequences. Assimilated Parasites have the ability to perform small leaps while in liquids and can also sink in these environments to pursue submerged targets. This adaptability enhances their threat level in aquatic environments.


§l§r§l§nTip§r:

• After defeating an Assimilated Parasite, it's crucial to remain vigilant. These creatures can either explode or release their heads as a final attack. Always be prepared for these potential threats even after they appear to have been subdued.

§l§nFaelis Claw:§r

The Faelis Claw plays a crucial role in close combat. Attacks performed by the player have a chance to inflict bleeding on the enemy for 5 seconds. If the player belongs to the Faeles Race (details in upcoming quests), the bleeding duration is tripled.


§5§n§lTasks:

§r§5• Kill 5 Primitive Devourers
• Get 10 Leather
• Get 32 Iron Ingots
• Craft 1 Glowing Gem

§l§nStone of Negative Gravity:§r

This item makes the player literally ignore gravity. The player doesn't fall, neither can jump. In order to go up press Left Click, in order to go down press Shift + Left Click. This makes the stone very good special bauble when it comes to building things in the air, or doing daily stuff. Not very good in combat. 


§5§n§lTasks:
§r
§5• Craft 10 Glowing Ingots
• Craft 10 Compass
• Get 32 End Stones
• Get 25 Shulker Shells

§l§nArcane Assimilated Villagers:§r

Over time, the Arcane Villagers' bodies have been infused with significant mystical energy. When assimilated, their powerful properties are retained, granting unique effects and statuses beyond those of regular Assimilated Villagers. By crafting the §5§lBook of Skills§r, you unlock one of the core principles of Arcane mastery: §l§nskill traits§r. For centuries, the Villagers of Arcanya have relied on this technique for survival and prosperity. Skill knowledge embodies a form of body art, derived from the acquisition of hidden ancient theories intertwined with experience. These theories are scattered throughout the world in the form of §l§n"Scrolls"§r, waiting to be discovered. 


§n§lThe Book of Skills works like a book with its own GUI and features the following:§r

§l1. Skills:§r Level up your unlocked Skill Traits using XP.

§l2. Abilities:§r The Book of Skills can include an Anvil, a Crafting Table and an Enchanting table. Each be unlocked using special Scrolls.

§l3. XP Bank:§r Store your personal XP. Won't be lost on death.

§lWould you like to establish the communication route?

§l§nInfernian Planet

§rThe Infernian Planet is a world of searing heat, molten landscapes, and relentless volcanic activity. Its inhabitants, the Infernian Species, have evolved to not just survive, but thrive in such extreme conditions, mastering the element of fire and heat in ways unimaginable to others. Their advanced technology is intimately connected to their fiery environment, enabling them to harness flames and lava as potent sources of energy and weaponry.

The Infernians are known for their expertise in crafting fire-based weapons—tools of destruction forged in the intense heat of their volcanic forges. These weapons, imbued with the essence of their planet, have the power to unleash devastating flames, melt through nearly any material, and burn with unquenchable fury. Their ability to manipulate fire allows them to create items capable of incinerating enemies and overwhelming even the most resilient of parasites.

After the §l§nCalamity War§r, the Infernian Species took a keen interest in Earth, particularly due to the parasites' vulnerability to fire. Their visits have become more frequent, as they see Earth's evolving threats as a proving ground for their technology. They believe that fire, when wielded properly, could be the key to eradicating the parasites and ensuring balance across the cosmos.


§6§l§nInfernian Weapons:§o

§r§l§r§lIgnis Knife§r
• 45 Damage
• 2.2 Attack Speed
• Has a chance to burn Parasites
• When burning, it deals additional Damage
• Fire Aspect increases the Damage significantly

§r§l§r§lUpgrade: Ignis Chakram
§r• 45 Damage
• 2.0 Attack Speed
• Has a chance to burn Parasites
• When burning, it deals additional Damage
• Fire Aspect increases the Damage significantly
• Can be thrown like a boomerang, dealing more Damage


§4§l§nImportant:§r

§4Once this route is established, no other can be initiated until it's completed.
