§lWould you like to establish the communication route?

§l§nCLM-07 Planet

§rThe CLM-07 Planet is a harsh and perilous world, known as the very birthplace of the parasites that now threaten the galaxy. Unlike other planets, CLM-07 is not defined by a single race or culture. It has become a melting pot, attracting diverse races from across the stars, all drawn by one common goal: to study the parasites up close and harness their powers in a desperate bid to survive.

The parasites that infest this world are unlike any other. They are constantly evolving, adapting to their environment, and posing a lethal challenge to all who dare study them. However, the species gathered on CLM-07 have found a way to fight back—not by overpowering the parasites, but by imitating them. By observing and borrowing parasite abilities, the inhabitants of the planet have learned to adapt to the parasites' biology. They integrate parasite traits into their own biology, mimicking their resilience, regeneration, and adaptation powers.

The study of the parasites has led to the creation of unique weapons and tools, some of which are imbued with the very essence of the creatures they are meant to destroy. Scientists and warriors alike work tirelessly in their fortified research stations, all the while keeping a wary eye on the ever-growing parasite colonies surrounding them. §lThe CLM-07 Conquerors§r, as the planet’s inhabitants have come to be known, continue to push the boundaries of science and survival, creating a dangerous blend of parasite and sentient being.


§4§l§nCLM-07 Weapons:§o

§r§l§r§lOutbreak Dagger§r
• 55 Damage
• 15,000 Durability
• 3.3 Attack Speed
• Chance of inflicting the Viral effect

§r§l§r§lUpgrade: Seizer Spear
§r• 110 Damage
• 10,000 Durability
• 12.75 Blocks extra reach
• Chance of inflicting Slowness and Weakness
• On Right-Click, places a friendly Seizer that attracts and holds the enemies in one place

§lUpgrade: Seismic Warhammer
§r• 230 Damage
• 0.5 Attack Speed
• 20,000 Durability
• 10 Blocks extra reach
• Chance of inflicting Slowness and Weakness
• Chance of Stunning enemies
• When attacking the ground, it creates a Wave going forward that applies 100 Damage upon contact
• Combined with Fire Enchantments, the Wave can burn the victims upon contact


§4§l§nCLM-07 Tools:§o§r

§lLongarm Appendage:§r
• 15.75 Blocks extra reach when holding in Offhand

§lUpgrade: Extended Appendage:§r
• 20.75 Blocks extra reach when holding in Offhand


§4§l§nImportant:§r

§4Once this route is established, no other can be initiated until it's completed.

§lWould you like to establish the communication route?

§l§nCertus Planet

§rThe Certus Planet is home to highly advanced technology capable of manipulating both space and time. These powerful advancements have drawn significant attention, and some of their most sophisticated items are now available for the player to use. This is primarily because the Certus Species has visited Earth on numerous occasions, conducting extensive research on the evolution of the parasites that have plagued the planet.

Following the §l§nCalamity War§r, Earth has become an even greater focal point for the Certus, as the aftermath of the war revealed new opportunities for their studies. The heightened interest from the Certus Species stems from their desire to understand not only the development of parasites but also the larger consequences of such a catastrophic event. Their repeated visits have left behind advanced technology that humans, and by extension the player, can now access. These tools offer unparalleled control over space-time, making them invaluable in the ongoing battle against the parasites and other cosmic threats.

As the Certus continue their research, their influence on Earth grows, opening the door to further collaboration and the potential for even more powerful technological advancements to be shared in the future.


§b§l§nCertus Weapons:§o

§r§l§r§lGenome De-Splicer§r§r
• 120 Damage
• 10,000 Durability
• Has a chance of removing Adaptation Points from the Parasites

§r§l§r§lUpgrade: Cytokine Mutator
§r• 130 Damage
• 10 Blocks extra reach
• 15,000 Durability
• Has a chance of removing Adaptation Points from the Parasites
• With each Adaptation Point removed, the weapon deals 2 Extra Damage

This action will reestablish the communication link, allowing the signal to continue uninterrupted across the vast distances of the universe.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Greetings, human! I am §lQuin'tarok§r, and I’m pleased you've come to us for assistance. Rest assured, despite our advanced technology, we mean you no harm. In fact, we share a common goal: the eradication of the parasite infestation. I’m here to help, provided you're willing to cooperate.

Let me bring you up to speed. In our galaxy, we’ve established a massive station built within an asteroid, solely dedicated to the development of advanced weaponry designed specifically to combat the parasites. We call this facility the §lSpatial Genetic Assembler and Disassembler (SGAD)§r.

This station is still in the experimental phase, and to create effective weapons, we require specific ingredients. The parasites that provide these materials are extremely rare, and that’s where you come in. Earth’s parasites have evolved in extraordinary ways, offering the potential for materials we’ve never encountered before.

Each time you send us these materials, we’ll process them through SGAD. However, for the station to manipulate parasite components, it must, in essence, become a parasite itself. Even inanimate parasite parts possess a form of consciousness, and to cooperate, they need to perceive the station as one of their kind. To "assimilate" the station, we’ll require natural essences, such as §2Organic Samples§r and §eWorm Acid§r. Your task is to collect these for our testing.

With your help, we can create weapons capable of turning the tide in this war against the parasites.


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid

§lQuin'Tarok§r here!

Great news—the machine has started working! We ran tests using our own parasite components, and it’s incredible: they listen, they cooperate!

That said, while this is a success, there's a catch. The Organic Samples and Worm Acid are being consumed quickly, almost like fuel. Unfortunately, they won't last long, so we'll need more to keep the machine running.

Now, let's move forward with the project. The weapon we're crafting for you is a blade designed to alter the genetic structure of parasites. In simple terms, with each strike, the parasites §c§nwill lose their ability to adapt§r. At last, we'll have a way to counter their greatest strength.

For the blade to be durable enough to endure the battle, it needs a strong handle. Below, I’ll provide a list of ingredients we need to gather for this next phase. Let's make this weapon a reality!


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid
• Send 1 Hardened Bone Handle
• Send 3 Strange Bone
• Send 5 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 1 Vengeful Core

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
It's §lQuin'Tarok§r!

The handle is showing great potential, but during our tests on various hardened surfaces, it didn’t hold up for long. We’re going to need additional materials to reinforce it properly.

On top of that, the station's performance seems sluggish today. It appears we’ll need more fuel to keep things running smoothly. Please gather the required resources so we can continue improving the weapon.


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 2 Strange Bone
• Send 5 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 1 Vengeful Core

Hello, friend! It's me.

With the reinforcement added, the handle is now incredibly durable, withstanding even the hardest materials under the highest force we could apply. In fact, we tested it in a hydraulic press, and it survived an impressive 12,543 tons of pressure.

Given this success, the weapon’s §c§ndurability is estimated to be around 10,000§r.

Now, we’ll proceed to the next phase: crafting the weapon’s Core. This is where the true magic happens. The Core, powered by the §4Rekindled Dispatcher§r, will issue commands to any matter it touches, forcing it to stop adapting. For this to work, we’ll need to establish a connection between the Dispatcher and the targeted parasites. This link is created using §4Fragmented Genomes§r, which must surround the Dispatcher for it to function properly.

Let’s move forward and get the Core assembled!


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 10 Fragmented Genome
• Send 5 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 2 Vengeful Core
• Send 1 Rekindled Dispatcher

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Sweet victory! Here, it's §lQuin Tarok§r.

The weapon is fully assembled and ready for use. We've tested it on multiple parasites, and it's performing exactly as we intended. We’ll now send you the weapon, and we’ve decided to name it: §l§nGene De-Splicer§r. Cool name, right?

Also, stay connected! We’re already planning the next project, and with your help, we’ll continue to upgrade this weapon to make it even more powerful. Of course, that will depend on the materials you bring us.

Thank you for your service, Eradicator! Enjoy your new weapon, and keep in touch!


§b§l§nGene De-Splicer Status:§o§r§b

• 120 Damage
• 10,000 Durability
• Has a chance of removing Adaptation Points from the Parasites

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Hey! §lQuin'Tarok§r on duty!

The Core’s mechanics are functioning perfectly! When I placed it in front of an Adapted Arachnida, the parasite actually began attacking itself with its claws. This is exactly what we intended, as the Dispatcher is programmed to fight against the parasites, not cooperate with them.

Now, we just need the final piece: §lthe Blade§r.

To connect the Blade to the Core, we’ll need more §4Fragmented Genomes§r. Additionally, §4Reeker Fangs§r will be essential for the sword's sharpness. If we melt down 5 fangs and properly sharpen them, I believe we can increase §c§nthe sword’s damage rating to 120§r.

Let’s gather these materials and finalize the weapon!


§b§l§nTasks:§r§b

• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 5 Fragmented Genome
• Send 5 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 5 Reeker Fang

Hello there! §lQuin'Tarok§r.

I’m glad you continue to seek our assistance, and with that, we must dive into our next project. Our goal is to upgrade the §lGene De-Splicer§r into something far more powerful and lethal. By reinforcing both the Blade and the Core, we aim to create a weapon capable of eradicating even the Ancients and Preeminents.

But first things first—we need to power up the station again. This time, it’s going to require a greater amount of fuel to handle the upgrades.

Let’s get started! We’ll need you to gather the necessary fuel so we can begin powering up the station for this ambitious project.


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid

§lQuin'Tarok§r here!

The station is up and running! Awesome! Now, let’s kick off the reinforcement project by creating a carcass for your current blade. This will make your sword larger and heavier, but significantly more resistant.

We’ll need to use 5 additional §4Semi-Organic Steel§r pieces to boost the weapon's §c§ndurability up to 15,000§r. Additionally, by embedding a few more §4Reeker Fangs§r beneath the blade, we can further enhance its sharpness for better efficiency in combat.

Let’s gather the materials and get started! Your upgraded weapon is going to be a real game-changer.


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid
• Send 5 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 5 Reeker Fang

Hello, Eradicator! It's §lQuin'Tarok§r.

Your materials have proven to be highly efficient! The carcass is now more durable than ever, and with its increased length and weight, it’s capable of delivering incredibly powerful attacks.

Now, let's enhance the sharpness further. We’ll need 5 additional §4Reeker Fangs§r to refine the blade. To strengthen the connection between the Core and the Blade, we’ll also need some §4Fragmented Genomes§r to line the interior of the carcass walls. This will make the bond between the components much stronger, ensuring the weapon functions at peak performance.

Once we gather these, we’ll be ready to complete the last step of the upgrade!


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid
• Send 5 Reeker Fang
• Send 5 Fragmented Genome

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Hello! You’re reaching §lQuin'Tarok§r!

The carcass is finally ready, and now it’s time to bring your new sword to life with some serious upgrades. To increase its power and influence over both the sword and its targets, we’ll need to create a brand-new Core. However, one Dispatcher won’t be enough this time—we’ll need to craft two artificial Rekindled Dispatchers to handle the extra load.

Additionally, by embedding Wrathful Cores, the sword will be able to counter-attack affected parasites based on how many adaptation points they lose. The overall §c§ndamage of your sword will increase to 130, and for every adaptation point removed, you’ll gain 2 more damage§r.

We’ll also need your §l§nGene De-Splicer§r so we can attach the newly reinforced carcass to it. I know it’ll be tough to part with such a powerful weapon, but I promise it’s for a good cause. In the shortest time possible, you’ll receive a weapon that’s on an entirely new level of power. Trust me, this upgrade will be well worth the wait!


§b§l§nTasks:

§r§5§b• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 2 Rekindled Dispatcher
• Send 10 Fragmented Genome
• Send 2 Wrathful Core
• Send 1 Gene De-Splicer

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
At last, the project is complete! For one final time, this is §lQuin Tarok§r.

The Gene De-Splicer has successfully bonded with its new carcass, and it’s ready for action. We’ve named this new weapon: the §l§nCytokine Mutator§r!

The "Mutator" attribute comes from its unique ability: not only will your enemies lose adaptation points, but their genes will be altered, causing them to §c§ntake additional damage for each point removed§r.

Thanks to the Wrathful Cores, the new Blade is infused with powerful energy. Even though the blade is long, its slashing radius extends even further, giving you an extra §c§n10 blocks of Reach§r!

I’ve enjoyed working alongside you, and your efforts have been nothing short of extraordinary. You’ve not only served our planet, but the entire galaxy. Because of your hard work and patience, you’ve rightfully earned the title of §4§l§nThe Eradicator§r.

Use the Cytokine Mutator well, and may it bring victory!


§b§l§nCytokine Mutator Status:§o
§r
§b• 130 Damage
• 10 Blocks extra Reach
• 15,000 Durability
• Has a chance of removing Adaptation Points from the Parasites
• With each Adaptation Point removed, the weapon deals 2 Extra Damage

Thank you for contacting us. I'll skip the unnecessary details—my name is §lSerin Drakor§r, and I’ll be your assistant moving forward. For reasons that align with our own interests, we’ve decided to help you, as Earth has become a breeding ground for Parasites. Less fire, more population — it’s become a perfect place for them to evolve. This poses a threat not only to Earth but to all interstellar species.

Listen, and do it closely. As you may have already discovered, Parasites are particularly vulnerable to fire. So, fire will be our weapon of choice. With the unique materials that only you can provide, we’ll craft powerful fire-based weapons to bring balance to the Parasite population. These weapons will not only be engulfed in flames but will also pack immense power and flexibility for combat.

The weapons will be forged within a volcano that has been assimilated after a Parasite Biome was eradicated. However, perfection is elusive. The volcano requires §2Organic Samples§r and §eWorm Acid§r to manipulate Parasite components for weapon forging, so you’ll need to keep supplying these materials on a regular basis.

Now, don't make us wait and let's get to work.


§6§l§nTasks:
§6
• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid

At times, the signal may be disrupted, halting communication. To restore and maintain the connection, you must send an §6Infernian Signal§r into space. 

1. Equip your Interstellar Network Link.

2. Place an Infernian Signal in your offhand, ensuring it is ready to be deployed.

3. Once positioned, aim the Interstellar Network Link and shoot the signal into space.

This action will reestablish the communication link, allowing the signal to continue uninterrupted across the vast distances of the universe.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Very well, let’s move quickly.

The volcano demands an §lIgnis Knife§r, and an Ignis Knife we shall forge. We’ll split this process into two phases: first, we’ll craft the §lBody§r of the weapon, and then we’ll focus on the §lCore§r, where all the magic happens.

For the body, we need to ensure the §lHandle§r is properly reinforced. This will be done by combining §4Strange Bones§r and §4Yelloweye Bones§r and then covering it in §4Semi-Organic Steel§r for added strength. The Blade itself must be sharp but kept small, so only one §4Reeker Fang§r will be necessary. Finally, to make sure the knife burns fiercely, we will cover the entire weapon in §4Incinerated Flesh§r, making it able to withstand the flames.

Now, let’s get started — time is of the essence!


§6§l§nTasks:
§6
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 3 Strange Bone
• Send 3 Yelloweye Bone
• Send 1 Reeker Fang

When combined with fire elements, the blade will ignite instantly. Additionally, we need §5Arcane elements§r to ensure these flames come to life and burn fiercely.

I trust you'll gather the best possible materials to bring this weapon to its full potential. Once done, we'll have a blade unlike any other. Let's finish this!

There you go! At least the humans know how to cooperate… I wish the other species were as willing. Now, take the §l§nIgnis Knife§r and put it to good use. It should be more than enough for your daily combat needs, boasting §c§n45 Damage§r and an §c§nAttack Speed of 2.2§r. As you strike, there’s §c§na chance your target will catch fire§r, dealing extra damage over time.

One last tip: enchant your knife as soon as you can. §c§nThe Fire Aspect enchantment will almost double your damage§r, thanks to the Arcane elements you provided.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
It seems you've grown a bit weary of the knife, but no worries — an upgrade is already in the works. Not that you asked for it, but the volcano demands it. You’ll be getting a more powerful weapon soon, and I trust you’re as ready to take on the tasks as you were before.

Time isn’t on our side, so let’s fuel the volcano and get started. The next phase awaits!


§6§l§nTasks:
§6
• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid

Good! The volcano has been sufficiently fed. Now, let me introduce you to the next weapon we're going to forge.

It will be similar to what you call a "boomerang" on Earth, but we refer to it as a §lChakram§r. When you throw it, it will travel outward and then return, slicing through anything in its path. It shares many of the same properties as the Ignis Knife, but with one key difference—when thrown, §c§nit delivers significantly more damage and has the ability to pierce through entities§r.

We’ll start by crafting the §lCore§r first. Once that’s ready, we’ll connect it to the Knife, extending the blade into a long, circular shape using additional materials. The Core needs to be stronger this time, so the materials required will be more challenging to obtain.

Let’s begin the process and make this new weapon as powerful as it’s destined to be.


§6§l§nTasks:
§6
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 5 Living Nucleus
• Send 10 Living Core
• Send 3 Wrathful Core
• Send 15 Incinerated Flesh

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Now we need to focus on creating the parts that will connect the Core to the Blade. For this, we’ll require strong §4Parasite skin tendons and muscles§r, reinforced with an incredibly powerful steel to ensure durability. These connections must also be fueled by §5Arcane elements§r to maintain their ability to conduct the energy of the flames.

You'll need to gather the same Arcane materials as for the knife, but in much larger quantities. Once we have everything, we can proceed with assembling the Chakram into a devastating weapon. Let's get to work!


§6§l§nTasks:
§6
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 15 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 5 Unraveled Muscles
• Send 4 Black Opal
• Send 32 Mana Crystal
• Send 15 Incinerated Flesh
• Send 15 Altered Tendons
• Send 3 Dried Tendons

The Core, combined with the connections, has become one of the most powerful sources of energy I've ever encountered. It won’t fly due to its shape alone, but because the Core burns and propels itself by pushing the air around it. Truly impressive.

Now, let's focus on crafting the circular burning blade. Don’t worry, I won’t ask for the Ignis Knife, but we’ll need twice the amount of materials due to the larger size of the Chakram. This means more §4Reeker Fangs§r, additional §4Incinerated Flesh§r, and to ensure a proper energy flow, we’ll require §42 Living Nucleus§r for better energy distribution.

Gather these materials, and we’ll be ready to complete this formidable weapon!

§6

In melee combat, it retains the same damage as the Ignis Knife, but §c§nwhen thrown, its destructive potential nearly doubles§r. With the Fire Aspect enchantment added, even the Preeminents will fall before its flames, unable to withstand its might.

This weapon comes with a §c§ndurability of 15,000§r, ensuring it will last through countless battles. The §c§nAttack Speed is slightly reduced to 2.0§r due to the weapon's weight, but given the sheer power it holds, it remains more than sufficient.

You have done an incredible service to our race. From this day forward, with the volcano’s approval, we shall honor you with the title of §4§l§nThe Eradicator§r. Your dedication has earned our deepest gratitude. Thank you for your service!

§6

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Hello, and thank you for reaching out! I am §lPyrelos Ashborn§r, an Infernian, and I’ll be assisting you in crafting creative tools to help save your planet, as I’ve learned from my research team.

My story may not be too thrilling, but with the approval of our leaders, I joined the Certus program to study the environment of CLM-07 with one goal in mind—eradicating the parasites for good.

The machine we’re using requires §2Organic Samples§r and §eWorm Acid§r as fuel to operate effectively, so we’ll need to gather those resources before we can begin crafting the tools. I'll be patiently waiting for your materials. Best of luck, comrade!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid

Is that... a human? I haven't heard of humans since the §l§nCalamity War§r.

Hello, comrade. My name is §lMark Dougstein§r, but you can call me §lEradicator Mark§r. Like you, I am a human and I was living and fighting for Earth. I served at the Parasite Eradication Outpost, conducting numerous scouting missions. While it might seem that being surrounded by other Eradicators kept me safe, in reality, my mind was scattered—constantly burdened by the endless conflict.

As the Calamity War neared its end, our outpost was overrun by parasites. Despite the strength of our walls, which held up against their attacks, we were cut off from essential supplies, and chaos erupted inside. People were infected, and under orders from General Blockstorm, they were quickly executed. Soon, civil war broke out within the outpost, as the Eradicators turned on each other in a gruesome struggle—driven by hunger, despair, and conflicting ethics.

On the third day, the parasites finally broke through, wiping out what remained of us. Our one hope, the helicopter, had no fuel left. Just as I prepared to meet my fate, a light appeared in the sky—a massive ship. It wasn’t human-made. §lThe Certus§r species rescued me, the only human they saw, saying my luck had reached its peak. Because of their intervention, I now owe them everything.

Now, I still fight as an Eradicator, but not on Earth. The Certus sent me to a dangerous planet called CLM-07, the very origin of the parasites. It’s a place where Certus, along with other species from across the galaxy, gather to share knowledge and study the parasites, trying to learn their abilities for survival.

As an Eradicator on CLM-07, I will craft weapons for you that mimic the parasites' strengths. The first weapon you'll need is a small but deadly Dagger that will §c§ninflict a Viral Effect on parasites§r. To power up the machines we use here, we need to "assimilate" them with §2Organic Samples§r and §eWorm Acid§r — resources found only on Earth. You'll have to send me these materials to get the process started.

I'm awaiting your response. May luck be on your side, comrade!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid

Hello, comrade! Glad to hear you’re still with us—though I understand, staying human keeps us a bit realistic about things.

The machine is now operational and demanding materials for the Dagger. We’ll begin with crafting the §lHandle§r, which will be key to this weapon. At the top of the handle, we’ll place the §4Vengeful Core§r, infusing the dagger with the energy it needs to deal devastating blows. To connect the handle to the blade, we’ll use §4Rewoven Flesh§r, a vital material that ensures flexibility and durability upon impact.

For the handle itself, we’ll use the §4Arachnida Claw§r, a lightweight material that will make the weapon easy to maneuver. This, combined with other materials, will provide both strength and speed—ideal for striking at parasites with precision.

Let’s gather the materials and start crafting!

§r§4
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 10 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 5 Strange Bone
• Send 2 Rewoven Flesh
• Send 1 Vengeful Core
• Send 5 Arachnida Claw

Hello, comrade! I have fantastic news—the Handle is complete and glowing with energy, a true testament to its power! This'll bring the weapon up to §c§n15,000 Durability§r!

Now, we’re onto the final step: crafting the §lBlade§r. This blade will be unique, as it will §c§ninflict the Viral Effect on parasites§r, disabling their adaptation by infusing it with §4Viral Glands§r. It will be powered by the §4Vengeful Cores§r and reinforced using both §4Reeker Fangs§r and §4Rewoven Flesh§r. These elements will combine to create one of the finest martial weapons, perfect for quick and devastating strikes.

With this, the dagger will be unmatched in speed and strength, a weapon truly fit for an §4§l§nEradicator§r. Let's get to work and finish this masterpiece!

It seems that fate still favors humankind in the end... The parts of the weapon have come together, and with our combined will to fight for good, the §l§nOutbreak Dagger§r is finally complete.

You might be wondering about the name. For me, it carries personal meaning. This dagger reminds me of the day my new journey began, the day of the Outbreak — the event that transformed my life. I was born in that chaos, and when my time comes, I expect to die in an Outbreak as well.

The Outbreak Dagger has an exceptionally sharp blade, §c§ndealing 55 damage§r. Its lightweight construction gives it excellent mobility, allowing an §c§nattack speed of 3.3§r, making it quick and efficient in battle. Additionally, it carries a §c§nchance of inflicting the Viral Effect on parasites§r, weakening them further.

It is now in your hands, comrade. Use it well!


§4§l§nOutbreak Dagger Status:§o§r§

§4
• 55 Damage
• 15,000 Durability
• 3.5 Attack Speed
• Chance of inflicting the Viral effect

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Greetings once again, comrade!

I trust you're enjoying your Outbreak Dagger! If that wasn’t enough, you’ve arrived just in time. We’ve got a new project underway for you: a §lSpear§r, designed for long-range, defensive combat. The machine is prepped with the materials you previously gathered, so we just need to keep it powered and collect a few more resources to kickstart this new weapon.

Since the Spear’s §lHandle§r is exceptionally long, we’ll need substantial materials for its structure and reinforcement. Along with §4Semi-Organic Steel§r, we’ll be using §4Longarm Armor Fragments§r to fortify the spear’s core. These fragments will be bound and supported by §4Devourer Tentacles§r, adding flexibility and durability to the weapon. With some luck and precise craftsmanship, the spear’s blade could extend up to 12 blocks in length—a perfect weapon for keeping enemies at bay.

Let’s gather what we need and get to work on this new creation!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 15 Yelloweye Bone
• Send 5 Longarm Armor Fragment
• Send 20 Semi-Organic Steel
• Send 10 Devourer Tentacle

It’s great to hear that the handle is holding up so well! Its solidity is exactly what we need for a weapon of this scale and as a conclusion, it'll reach up to §c§n10,000 durability§r. Now, let’s move forward with creating the §lCore§r.

After analyzing the recent Eradication tasks and studying the §lDispatcher's defensive mechanisms§r, we’ve decided to replicate their tactic of immobilizing enemies. During the battle against the Colony, the Dispatcher generated Seizers to keep us in place, and we’ll incorporate that into the spear’s design.

To achieve this, we’ll use a §4Rekindled Dispatcher§r for the Core. This will allow the spear to trigger defensive immobilization on enemies it strikes. To power this core, we’ll require both §4Vengeful and Wrathful Cores§r, ensuring the spear has the energy it needs to maintain this powerful ability. Once the core is prepared, we’ll attach it to the handle using §4Dried Tendons§r, ensuring both flexibility and strength.

Let’s push forward and bring this weapon to life!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 3 Vengeful Core
• Send 3 Wrathful Core
• Send 1 Rekindled Dispatcher
• Send 5 Dried Tendons

With the Core working flawlessly, we're nearing the final stages of crafting the Spear. The last task is to complete the §lEdge§r. For this, we’ll need a combination of §4Arachnida Claws and Reeker Fangs§r, which will be fastened to the handle using §4Dried Tendons§r. Once these materials are in place, the Spear's structure will be solid and ready for battle.

Additionally, we’ll need you to return the §l§nOutbreak Dagger§r. We plan to melt it down and infuse the substance into the spear’s Edge, giving it similar properties that inflict status effects on enemies. However, instead of applying the Viral Effect, we’ll enhance it using a §4Reprogrammed Gland§r. This will allow the spear to §c§ninflict Weakness and Slowness§r, giving you the perfect opportunity to gain the upper hand in combat or escape danger when needed.

Once we gather these final materials, your new weapon will be complete!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 1 Reprogrammed Gland
• Send 10 Arachnida Claw
• Send 5 Reeker Fang
• Send 15 Dried Tendons

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The work we've done together has paid off, comrade. The weapon is finally complete, and I’ve named it the §l§nSeizer Spear§r, a reflection of its powerful defensive abilities. It's particularly effective when you're being pursued by multiple parasites, thanks to its ability to §c§ninflict Slowness and Weakness§r upon contact. With an impressive §c12.75 blocks of extra reach§r, you can strike from afar, keeping enemies at bay. Plus, its §c§n110 damage and 10,000 durability§r make it a versatile weapon, equally effective for offensive combat.

The spear's most notable feature is its special ability: §c§nby holding Right-Click, you can throw a Seizer§r — a friendly parasite with 200 health that can withstand heavy attacks. It remains active for 1 minute and 40 seconds, attracting nearby enemies and keeping them occupied while you plan your next move.

As one human to another, I know how vital it is for us to support each other in these difficult times. With your help, I was even able to craft a Seizer Spear for myself using the leftover materials. I appreciate your assistance, and I look forward to collaborating on future projects.


§4§l§nSeizer Spear Status:§o§r§

§4
• 110 Damage
• 10,000 Durability
• 12.75 Blocks extra Reach
• Chance of inflicting Slowness and Weakness
• On Right-Click, places a friendly Seizer that attracts and holds the enemies in one place

I don't have much time to talk, as there's a Horde approaching our Research Facility. But before I go into battle, let me brief you on our next project. We're going to craft a §lHammer§r, one of the strongest weapons ever made. The machine is still running, so we can begin by working on the §lHandle§r. It will need serious reinforcement to support the massive Head of the hammer.

I'll list the required materials below for you to gather while I'm out. The Horde will be my perfect chance to test the §l§nSeizer Spear§r I’ve kept for myself. Good luck, partner — I'll be back soon!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Hello, comrade!

The Horde was a success, and the Seizer Spear proved invaluable in the fight! With the battle behind us, we also managed to complete the Handle for the Hammer. Now is the perfect time to move on to the next step: crafting the §lCore§r.

This §lHammer§r is going to be special. We want it to store a massive amount of energy, allowing it to unleash a devastating ability. §c§nWhen smashed to the ground with full force, it will create a massive wave§r, much like a Primitive or Adapted Longarms Parasite does, releasing energy capable of decimating large groups of parasites.

To make this happen, we’ll need a few key materials: §4Living Nucleus, Wrathful Cores, and, most importantly, parts from a Longarms Parasite§r, which will allow us to inherit this incredible wave-generating ability. We’ll connect the Core to the Hammer using §4Dried Tendons§r, and the energy will be channeled and spread through §4Fragmented Genomes§r.

Once we gather these materials, the hammer’s potential will be fully realized. Let's get started!

Wonderful news! The Core is functioning perfectly. When we tested it, it shook violently, as though it was hungry for battle—truly a sign that everything is going according to plan. Now we move on to the final and most important part: the §lHead of the Hammer§r.

The §lHead§r needs to be the heaviest and most durable part of the weapon, built from the strongest materials we can gather. Once tied together using §4Dried Tendons§r and connected to the Core with §4Fragmented Genomes§r, it will radiate pure destructive energy, ready to obliterate anything in its way.

Additionally, we want the Hammer to share the Effect ability of the §l§nSeizer Spear§r. For that, I’ll need both your Spear and mine to melt down and integrate into the weapon. Combined with the immense energy from the Core, this will allow the hammer to §c§ninflict Weakness and Slowness on a much greater scale, paralyzing any target hit with it§r.

Let's gather everything needed and finalize this powerful weapon!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
And... with these final words, I’m proud to announce that the §lHammer§r is complete! It's wonderful properties have entitled it as the §l§nSeismic Warhammer§r!

My team and I personally took it for an in-depth test, and the results were beyond expectations. We obliterated an entire Parasite Biome using the hammer’s devastating power. Thanks to the materials we used, the hammer boasts an astounding §c§ndurability of 20,000§r. As for its §c§ndamage — it’s an incredible 230§r.

When the hammer is §c§nsmashed into the ground, it generates a massive wave that instantly wiped out large groups of Feral and Primitive Parasites§r. The Handle allows the user to §c§nreach targets up to 10 blocks away§r, making it a versatile and formidable weapon in both close and long-range combat.

Even more impressive is that the hammer retains the ability to §c§ninflict Weakness and Slowness§r, making it not only a brutal offensive tool but also effective in defense. This versatility, combined with its high damage and durability, makes it one of the deadliest and most powerful weapons in the galaxy.

Now, it’s time for me to continue my journey. Farewell, comrade—or should I say, §4§l§nEradicator§r! You’ve done an immense service in the fight to save humankind, and I hope that one day we’ll reunite on a Reborn Earth, where we can share a coffee and talk about how we survived these battles together.

Stay strong!


§4§l§nSeismic Warhammer Status
§r§

§4• 230 Damage
• 0.5 Attack Speed
• 20,000 Durability
• 10 Blocks extra reach
• Chance of inflicting Slowness and Weakness
• Chance of Stunning enemies
• When attacking the ground, it creates a Wave going forward that applies 100 Damage upon contact
• Combined with Fire Enchantments, the Wave can burn the victims upon contact

Very well! The machine is in full operation, and it’s time to dive straight into the project. We're working on creating a massive §lEnergy-Infused Tentacle§r that will grant you the ability to §c§nextend your reach when using various weapons§r. Essentially, it will act as a §c§n"support for extended reach"§r. perfect for reaching distant targets in battle.

To begin, we need to focus on constructing the structure of the tool. Since it's a tentacle, we'll be using parasite parts to ensure it remains both flexible and resilient. The core components will be the §4Host Tentacle and Longarm Armor Fragment§r, providing the foundation. These parts will be reinforced by binding them tightly with §4Devourer Tentacles and Dried Tendons§r, which will enhance the tool's durability and flexibility.

For extra reinforcement, we’ll incorporate §4Vile Shells§r to toughen the structure further, ensuring that the tentacle is capable of withstanding intense combat scenarios.

Let's get started with these materials to bring this unique weapon support to life!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 50 Organic Sample
• Send 50 Worm Acid
• Send 5 Host Tentacle
• Send 20 Longarm Armor Fragment
• Send 10 Devourer Tentacles
• Send 25 Dried Tendons
• Send 10 Vile Shell

Perfect! The tentacle has been successfully constructed using the materials we've incorporated. Now, it’s time to infuse it with §lEnergy§r so that it can "connect" seamlessly to the weapon of your choice.

To achieve this, we'll install a §4Rekindled Dispatcher§r, which will establish a telepathic connection between the tentacle and your weapon. The dispatcher will be powered by §4Vengeful Cores§r and linked through §4Fragmented Genomes§r, ensuring a constant flow of energy between the tentacle and your chosen weapon.

This will allow you to attack in a wireless mode, enhancing your reach and control in battle without needing physical connection! It's time to bring this to life!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 1 Rekindled Dispatcher
• Send 3 Vengeful Core
• Send 10 Fragmented Genome

Thank you for contacting me once again! It sounds like you’re ready for an upgrade, and you’ve come to the right place. The machine is still operational and ready to kick things into gear!

To start, we’re going to build a more flexible and durable carcass for your tentacle, extending its reach and resilience significantly. This upgrade will require more materials than before—specifically, additional §4Host Tentacles§r and §4Longarm Armor Fragments§r. On top of that, we’ll need a stronger layer of reinforcement to ensure it remains durable during intense combat.

Once you gather the materials, we’ll get to work on creating a longer and more resistant version of your §l§nLongarm Appendage§r. I’m ready when you are!


§4§l§nTasks:
§r§4
• Send 100 Organic Sample
• Send 100 Worm Acid
• Send 15 Host Tentacle
• Send 30 Longarm Armor Fragment
• Send 20 Devourer Tentacles
• Send 30 Dried Tendons
• Send 15 Vile Shell

The carcass is now stronger and more flexible than ever, a solid foundation for the next stage. Now, it's time to upgrade the §lCore§r.

You’ll need to send the §l§nLongarm Appendage§r back for further processing so we can enhance it with greater energy capabilities. I’ll return it to you with the upgrade once everything is complete. For this upgrade, we’ll need a more powerful energy source to extend its reach even further. §4Wrathful Cores and a Living Nucleus§r will provide the raw energy required, and in addition, another §4Rekindled Dispatcher§r will be necessary to handle the advanced functionality. Given the increased size of the new tool, we’ll also need more §4Fragmented Genomes§r to ensure a strong, stable connection.

Once we have these materials, the upgrade will be underway!

§r§4

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
This is the end of our journey, comrade. The upgrade is now complete, and it works better than I could have imagined. I tested it in my Offhand and managed to slay a Marauder §c§nfrom an incredible §c§n20.75 blocks away§r, without suffering a single scratch. This §l§nExtended Appendage§r truly is a masterpiece.

My race, the §lInfernians§r, is typically practical and reserved, preferring to focus on our work rather than interactions with others. But my time on CLM-07 has changed me, exposing me to new conditions and teaching me to look beyond brute strength. Back home, we worked with fire and force, but here, amongst other races, I’ve learned that sometimes the real key is practicality and thinking outside the box. You and the others helped me realize that.

I hope my story motivates you to push forward, to save your planet, and together, we will save the cosmos. I look forward to the day we may fight side by side against the threats that haunt our universe.

Thank you, §4§l§nEradicator§r, for everything. I wish you a long and prosperous life!
